219501.name: Under the Skin
219501.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Play aid and map PDF.

User summary:

An assortment of enhanced materials for use with Fear's Sharp Little Needles.

219502.name: Templars' Journey
219502.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the strategy game Templars' Journey, players prepare their knights and templar lords for the holy crusade in Jerusalem. Each time players choose their cards, they can play either safe (but not so worthwhile) actions or more profitable ones — but if an opponent has chosen the same more profitable action you both receive punishment for being too greedy.

The better you guess your opponents' choices, the more profit you'll make!

219503.name: Druid Spells VII (PRD)
219503.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level druid spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

219504.name: Druid Spells VII (3PP)
219504.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level druid spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

219505.name: Hero Realms: Contract Negotiation Promo Card
219505.description:
The Cityport of Thandar can be a place of chaos and treachery, but that frenetic nature can be your best defense. Mercenaries from the four lands come together to worship at the altar of coin, and your odds of survival tend to go up when you make certain alliances. Buy the best swords, spells, and arrows you can, and show your intentions by your alignments. Success waits for the wise investor, and fortune favors the gold.

Contract Negotiation is the first unaligned Action card for the Hero Realms Deckbuilding Game. Simply play it, name a faction, and the ally abilities of your cards with the chosen faction will trigger. At 2 Gold for a cost of 1, this is a solid early-game acquisition.

219506.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the Ticket to Ride - Rails and Sails game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train ,ship and harbour pieces and the train and ship cards from Ticket to Ride - Rails and Sails base game.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

The 9 bonuses give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
219506.name: Mediterranean (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride Rails and Sails)

219507.description:
Since being court-martialed by the Star Empire, smuggler and thief Joan Shengtu has done what she needed to do in order to survive—gaining a reputation along the way. When a new client’s mission goes sideways, Joan finds herself caught in the middle of dueling gambits between the Star Empire and the Trade Federation. Recruited to perform the heist of a lifetime, the fate of the Star Empire rests in her hands.

Rescue Run is an Event card for the award-winning Star Realms Deckbuilding Game, and it is based on the first Star Realms novel, Star Realms: Rescue Run. Events are shuffled into the Trade Deck, and resolve when they are revealed. Rescue Run has a powerful effect that gets even stronger as the game progresses and players improve their decks. Tension builds as the action unfolds, just like in the novel!
219507.name: Star Realms: Rescue Run Promo Card

219509.name: Captain Silver
219509.description:
Description from the publisher:

Pirates ahoy! Captain Silver has a piratetastic challenge for you: Feel and grab the right pirate object out of your pirate bag. If you grab the correct object, many treasures await. Get gold coins and sail with your pirate ship to treasure island — but only the quickest and most skillful pirate will win Captain Silver's treasure challenge!

219510.description:
Beast Masters is a Dice Placement Game for 2-5 Players. If you grew up playing any kind of Monster raising simulation game, you will fall in love with Beast Masters!

Take the role of a young, new Beast Trainer seeking fame and fortune! Spend your time training your beast, going on adventure and confronting threats that affect the citizens of Tymuria, all of which come to a head each Season with the Grand Capital Tournament!
219510.name: Beast Masters: Season One

219511.name: Worm Party
219511.description: In Worm Party, players attempt to escape the nibbles of Charly the chicken by hiding their wormlike fingers below the proper mounds.

219512.name: Tudor
219512.description:
Description from the publisher:

Being an English Lord in the early 16th century you try to get into the ranks on the court of Henry VIII Tudor.

To do so you use your priviledges and the help of your courtiers. Gather titles and gain more privilidges with them. use them wisely to collect prestige and wealth in all statecrafts.

Tudors is a clever worker placement game that comes with a unique gameplay. In their turn, all players play their Lord to play two out of 6 possible actions. But by doing so, they also activate their courtiers and the ones of the other players in the same area so these get actions, too. Plan ahead to make the most out of your turns and get the most actions from the other players turns, too.

Use your priviledges (represented by the rings on your fingers) wisely and protect them from the intrigues of other players, who will not hesitate to kill your courtiers if they have a chance to, and steal your priviledge for their favour.

Tudor has variable goals and also variable game mechanics. For every game you choose these randomly so each game will be different and you need to adapt your strategies.

219513.description:
Description from the publisher:

Up to two thousand pounds in weight and over ten feet tall, the bear is considered the biggest and heaviest terrestrial carnivore in the world. Of course, there is not just "one bear"; on the contrary, there are plenty of subspecies that differ from each other in various aspects. For instance, only the Kodiak bear (ursus arctos middendorffi) weighs about 2,000 lbs. The polar bear (ursus maritimus) weighs "only" 1,100 lbs., but gets much bigger than the Kodiak bear, being as much as 11 ft. tall!

Bärenpark takes you into the world of bears, challenging you to build your own bear park. Would you like another polar bear enclosure or rather a koala* house? The park visitors are sure to get hungry on their tour through the park, so build them places to eat! Whatever your choices are, make sure you get the next building permit and use your land wisely! (* No, koalas aren't bears but they're so cute, we couldn't leave them out of this game!)

In more detail, each player in Bärenpark builds their own bear park, attempting to make it as beautiful as they can, while also using every square meter possible. The park is created by combining polyomino tiles onto a grid, with players scoring for animal houses, outdoor areas, completed construction, and more. The sooner you build it, the better! Cover icons to get new tiles and park sections. The game ends as soon as one player has finished expanding their park, then players tally their points to see who has won.
219513.name: Bärenpark

219526.name: Magnamund Menagerie
219526.description:
From the introduction:

This book catalogues some of the most famous and infamous creatures of Magnamund and presents them in an easy to use format for the Lone Wolf Adventure Game system. Additionally, it provides evocative descriptions, histories, combat traits, and special rules relevant to each.

From an acquisitive Szall to a hideous Helghast, great care has been taken to make sure that the men and monsters represented here are accurate profiles of the ones that first appeared in Joe Dever’s original gamebook series, replete with lots of extra information that will enhance your understanding and enjoyment of his unique creations.

The book serves as a springboard for Narrators and Players alike, with a special chapter devoted to the art of bringing these monsters alive, so that each encounter will have something to savour and be remembered for everyone involved. This book also introduces some powerful new adversaries, such as Undead from Ixia, powerful warriors and sorcerers from foreign nations such as the Sharnazim, the Cener Druids and the Shadakine Wytches, and fearsome Darkspawn that guard the fortresses of the Darkords.

As well as being a fascinating read in its own right, this book provides the ultimate toolkit for the Narrator who needs to pull together an encounter scenario quickly, but is understandably reluctant to compromise on quality for the sake of expedience. The best and the worst of the wonderful world of Magnamund await you. Turn the page… if you dare!

219527.name: Namidano Festival
boardgamepublisher: 大気圏内ゲームズ (Taikikennai Games)
219527.description:
In this game you are scouting band members to create cool and exciting bands. You will then help these bands debut, making a name for themselves, before your talent agency runs out of money. Of course, you will also be aiming to get these bands in to perform at the legendary Namidano Festival, on that famed stage that people are always talking about.

Namidano Festival is a band management card game in which you will rely on your assessment of possibilities as well as your luck with timing. Players will take on the role of talent management, working within the limits of their hand of cards, efficiently building bands in order to build the reputation of their talent agency. Along the way, you will be managing your bands, getting them into events, and hopefully the festival itself, scoring points along the way.

219528.name: Bushido: Ashinaga Tenaga
219528.description:
Description from the publisher:

Ashinaga Tenagis are usually sited in streams or rivers and it seems that they have a deep connection with the water, able to commune with the water around them to turn the land into a sea of mud. These yokai, long a legend amongst the peasants of the Ro-Kan, exact motivations for joining the fray are unknown but they are a welcome boost to the morale of the villagers they appear to protect, their presence imbuing a sense of belief in the common people enabling them to fight harder in defence of the balance of Jwar. To look at them individually one would think that they lack any combat skill, but once combined, one astride the other, the pair are a tricky opponent. With a snaring net in one hand which they use to either entangle an enemy up close or from afar, in the other a diamond sharp fishing spear handled with great precision.

219529.name: Bushido: Master Akari
219529.description:
Description from the publisher:

The legendary Master of the Temple’s slow and thoughtful nature with his students is the exact opposite when on the battlefield. The diminutive Tanuki is a cyclone of energy, flying between enemies in a flurry of blows, dashing from melee to melee. Nigh impossible to target at range the enemy must close in an attempt to deal with this furry thorn. The Temple do not exclude any who hold the needs of the many and protection of the realm above personal gain as their ideals, Master Akari & Kuma are perfect examples of this mentality.

219530.name: Bushido: Kaito
219530.description:
Description from the publisher:

What the peasants of the Ro-Kan lack in weapons and armour they make up for with their knowledge of the lands they are defending and with the ingenuity born from the necessity to survive in these times of war. Kaito’s tenacity on the battlefield is inspiring to those around him, allowing those imbued by his courage to shrug off lesser wounds. Knowing the lands like the back of his hand, allows Kaito and his allies to pass through the foliage unimpeded, meaning the Temple can pick their battles where the terrain is most advantageous.

219531.name: Bushido: Kyuubi
219531.description:
Description from the publisher:

Unlike the female Kitsune the males of this mysterious and seclusive yokai race cannot shapeshift and instead keep the form of an anthropomorphic fox. Kyuubi is a skilled warrior and hunter of those his people feel are to blame for the current imbalance in Jwar. He serves a swift and decisive punishment to those Shisai and Shugenja abusing the spirits for their own ends. Waiting silently in the cover of the foliage before striking like a vengeful spirit against the enemies of the Temple.

219532.name: Bushido: Oki Shisa
219532.description:
Description from the publisher:

The defence of the oldest temples and most sacred shrines is often entrusted to the great Oki Shisa. Mountains of ever watchful stone, still and silent for decades but always ready. None know how many Oki Shisa there are but these holy wardens are the bane of those who would attempt to manipulate their Ki against the Temple or hold sway over the land. The enchantments that gift the Shisa protection also imbue the stone with a keenness akin to a Masamune blade.

219533.name: Bushido: Master Enos
219533.description:
Description from the publisher:

None have managed to attain such a deep and wide understanding of the world as the venerable Master Enos. His body now old but his mind and powers have never been stronger. His knowledge of the elements enable him to exploit the very Kami themselves, drawing on their energy to transform himself into a conduit of nature’s strength. The other Masters however question how much this unique ability damages the balance and relationship the Temple holds with them. It is certainly obvious that Enos’s mastery of the Void has enabled him to unlock knowledge of the element thought lost and forgotten. Some powers though are better left lost.

219534.name: Synthicide
219534.description:
(publisher blurb)

When robots are gods, killing humans is fair game.

This is the full game, released January 2017. In this guide, you'll find everything you need to narrate compelling characters and thrilling adventures in a bleak, cynical universe where hunger guides your gunhand.

Synthicide brings the following to your game table:


A dark, hostile sci-fi setting where humans are worthless and money is everything
A galaxy of noir adventure and high technology
An attribute-based rule-set designed for imaginative role-play and full-throttle combat
Automated Game Master (GM) tools to quickly build NPCs, traps, and mission ideas – all on-demand
A Plot Twist system with surprises for players and game masters alike
Optional rules to up the grittiness and depth of the game, including Faction Heat, Mental Trauma, and Shock Damage

219535.name: Bushido: Yuuki
219535.description:
Description from the publisher:

Yuuki’s quickly found the name of the wind, where others hear only whistle and whisper. Yuuki hears the chatter of excited and boundless Kami. She is an able warrior and much like her element; rarely still, in play she is light and airy like a summer breeze but when called upon in battle she is a direct and relentless howling gale. Her vitality is endless and her speed astounding, her body a blur of motion as she unleashes blow after blow, an unstoppable storm of Rokan’s fury personified.

219536.name: Bushido: Kira
219536.description:
Description from the publisher:

Kira is an able and astute student, keen in practise and eager to study. Although slight in frame and few with words she is more than capable of holding her own against much larger foes. She spends hours each day in quiet meditation listening to the rocks and the stones and learning their secrets. From this knowledge she has started to unlock the power that lies silent within her, able to change her body for a short time into an impenetrable and unmoving barrier.

219537.name: Bushido: Kuma
219537.description:
Description from the publisher:

Kuma is the rock on which the water breaks the solid and resilient constant of the Temple. With Bo staff or claw he strikes out and floors foes with swift and brutal strikes. Despite his mass it is difficult to pin him down or outnumber him and with a practiced mediation Kuma can reach out to the roots of the earth to bind and hold firm those would overrun him.

219540.description: Ten high quality, 16mm faction dice for use with the Bushido - New Dawn miniatures strategy game.
219540.name: Bushido: Temple of Ro-kan Faction Dice

219541.name: Vampire: Undeath
219541.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you dare to walk the earth as an immortal? To stalk and hunt down mortals in the Modern Age? Take up the mantle of the vampire. Enjoy the trill of the hunt and fight their enemies as you experience Conspiratorial Horror as only Dark Phoenix can bring you!

Do you become an Eligiere, the nobles; or do you dive into the dark souls of the Bucoli? Perhaps you wish to run the nightclubs and stripjoints of the inner-city as a Cherche?

In this book you will discover how to play a modern vampire, build your skills and face deadly foes.

As always...Read with Caution...

219542.name: Mortifero Motus
219542.description:
User Summary

You seek to get to the end of the three-lane highway, dodging traffic, picking up cash, car, and health. Your car can rank up two levels and the tracks speed up through 9 levels, eventually even adding a police car that speeds up behind you, trying to drive you off the road.

219543.name: Yggdrasill magiA
219543.description:
Description from the publisher:

Yggdrasill magiA is a dice game with 21 dice. But it is not a dice game as you know it. This game uses cards to change the number of dice. And not only can you change your dice, but also the dice of others.

You have to change the dice to the number you want, otherwise, you can not win this game. Infer other people's hands and make the game you want. This game is a card game that deceives other players.

219545.description:
These play aids not only enable players to add a bluffing element to their Melee Exchanges, but also serve as reference for any Special Attack or Defence attempted. There are 17 cards in this card pack, one for each of the Special Attacks and Defences, one Unique Special Attack or Defence card and one Bluff card.

Players can replace verbally declaring the use of Special Attacks or Defences by instead placing the relevant card in front of them, then flipping the card to reveal any attempted after the dice have been rolled.
219545.name: Bushido: Special Attack & Defence Cards

219546.name: Ollinkalli
219546.description:
Description from the designer (Translated):
An abstract board game of both luck and strategy. Compete to get your pieces out of the board before the other players do.

Ollinkalli has a unique piece movement mechanic. When you move your own pieces, it's likely you'll be moving your opponents' too. You should be attentive and see if your moves benefit yourself or somebody else too. Be careful, maybe you are helping them to win before you do.

Description from the designer (Spanish):
Es un juego de mesa, de azar y estrategia, con un diseño y una mecánica de juego totalmente original. El objetivo es sacar todas tu piezas del tablero antes que los demas jugadores.

Ollinkalli destaca por la manera particular en que se mueven sus piezas. Cuando tu muevas tus piezas, es muy probable que muevas piezas de tus oponentes al mismo tiempo. Deberás fijarte muy bien si tus movimientos te ayudan solo a ti o también a alguien más.
Ten cuidado, si te distraes, quizás hasta los ayudes a ganar el juego antes que tú!

219547.name: Home by Dark
219547.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small band of kids and a friendly little robot with a dangerous secret. A girl hears a young boy’s voice on the radio asking for help and convinces her teacher to assist in tracking him down. The players of the school soccer team find an oversized egg during practice and hide it behind the bleachers, where it starts to hatch.

Home by Dark is a story game inspired by films and series like E.T., The Goonies, and Stranger things. You and your friends play as hopeful misfits whose lives are changed when they cross the path of a new ally with extraordinary abilities. As these characters protect their unusual friend and investigate mysterious pursuers, they will make discoveries about themselves and the strange events happening in their neighborhood. It’s a shared adventure that will have you and your friends feeling like you’re in a Steven Spielberg film.

219548.name: The Long Valley
219548.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The valley was tamed long ago. The deep gorges were bridged, a road cut through her swampy bottoms, and towers set to watch the road to keep the mountain’s predators at bay. That was long ago when the kingdoms of men were young and strong. For now the valley is empty of its old inhabitants. The towers are in ruin, the road in disrepair, and her people long gone. But it is not empty, for creatures have crept into the void, both deadly and mad. Even the bridges offer a deadly and dangerous challenge to the unsuspecting traveler.

The Long Valley is an overland adventure that allows the characters to explore the whole 30 mile stretch of country. The challenges range from the monstrous to the terrain, itself. Death lurks at every turn for the valley is as dangerous as it is beautiful. There are several encounter areas, including dungeons - loosely strung together.

219550.name: Gunman Taco Truck
219550.description:
Gunman Taco Truck is an action-packed drive across the post-apocalypse United States to reach the safe haven of Winnipeg, Canada, where there are no taco trucks and your family’s taco business can thrive.

Source: The Game Website.

219551.name: War Dragons
219551.description:
User Summary

Join a guild, help your teammates launch attacks in PVP, and hold off enemy raids in true real-time fashion.

219552.name: Grey Worlds (Volume III, Issue XIII - June 1992)
219552.description: This was a very professionaly done fanzine before ICE took it over. It contained many optional rules for Rolemaster.

219553.name: Inquest (Issue 41 - Sep 1998)
219553.description: Exclusive Board Game Inside says front cover!

219554.description: A print and play expansion for T.I.M.E Stories. The scenario takes place at the Peace Conference after WWI in Paris, France.
219554.name: Broken Peace (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)

219555.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2007
219555.description:
Total Extreme Wrestling 2007 allows players to take on the role of a wrestling promoter, where it is up to you to try and steer your chosen company to the top of the industry, along the way dealing with prima donna superstars, wars and alliances with other wrestling companies, and the demands of TV corporations! Along with several brand new features and improvements, TEW2007 will also include several additions suggested by fans of the series over the past year.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219556.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2008
219556.description:
Total Extreme Wrestling 2008 allows players to take on the role of a wrestling promoter, where it is up to you to try and steer your chosen company to the top of the industry, along the way dealing with prima donna superstars, wars and alliances with other wrestling companies, and the demands of TV corporations! Along with several brand new features and improvements, TEW2008 will also include several additions suggested by fans of the series over the past year.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219557.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2010
219557.description:
Total Extreme Wrestling 2010 allows players to take on the role of a wrestling promoter, where it is up to you to try and steer your chosen company to the top of the industry, along the way dealing with prima donna superstars, wars and alliances with other wrestling companies, and the demands of TV corporations! Along with several brand new features and improvements, TEW2010 will also include several additions suggested by fans of the series over the past year.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219558.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2013
219558.description:
Total Extreme Wrestling 2013 allows players to take on the role of a wrestling promoter, where it is up to you to try and steer your chosen company to the top of the industry, along the way dealing with prima donna superstars, wars and alliances with other wrestling companies, and the demands of TV corporations! Along with several brand new features and improvements, TEW2013 will also include several additions suggested by fans of the series over the past year. The jump from TEW2008 to TEW2010 was the biggest and best the series has had, featuring over 200 new additions and improvements. TEW2013 has over 350 further additions and improvements to 2010 and marks to largest leap in the series!

Source: The Publisher Website.

219559.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2016
219559.description:
Total Extreme Wrestling 2016 is the seventh and best game in the award-winning TEW franchise by Adam Ryland and Grey Dog Software. Bigger and more packed with enhanced features than ever before, the game takes its extremely popular predecessor TEW2013 and adds over 500 new features and improvements, including many long-awaited additions requested by the fans themselves. With new options that allow users to tone down the complexity of the game, TEW2016 is the ideal jumping on point for new fans too!

Source: The Publisher Website.

219560.name: Wrestling Spirit
219560.description:
Wrestling Spirit, created by Adam Ryland, takes its lead from its predecessor, Total Extreme Wrestling, and allows you to take control of the career of a professional wrestler, guiding his career through the world title wins, the tough matches, and the rivalries. You will control each match, negotiate contracts, personal finances, deal with injuries, and manage all the backstage politics. The accurate simulation engine and realistic AI offers up an extremely unique and immersive wrestling experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219561.name: Wrestling Spirit 2
219561.description:
hoenix, AZ March 30, 2006 ? Grey Dog Software, a Phoenix based developer of sports management simulation software, is announcing a new title called Wrestling Spirit 2 (WreSpi2). WreSpi2 is the sequel to the popular simulator "Wrestling Spirit: Rookie To Legend". WreSpi2 builds upon the success of its predecessor, adding more depth and numerous new features.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219562.name: Wrestling Spirit 3
219562.description:
Wrestling Spirit 3 is the third version in the popular Wrestling Spirit line and adds new options and features. Like the prior two, the primary career mode sees you take control of a professional wrestler, guiding him through the tough matches and the heated rivalries toward the chance of glory in title matches around the world. The game also features tournament and league modes, as well as an in-depth editorial suite.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219563.name: The Hand That Feeds
219563.description:
(publisher blurb)

Give your boss a hand...

Chubbs LaCroix had his hand (and favorite gun) bitten off by a gator, and it’s made him a bit ornery. He’s tasked his loyal underlings with finding the beast and bringing back his missing limb.

In order to find the gator, the Fated will have to brave the many (many, many) dangers of the Bayou, including giant toads, hungry pigs, and the wrath of the Swamp Witch herself.

The Hand That Feeds is a fun and challenging One Shot adventure for the Through the Breach roleplaying game. It requires the Fated Almanac to play and comes with 5 pregenerated characters.

Into the Bayou is recommended to get the most out of this adventure, but it is not required.

219564.name: Final War
219564.description:
Final War is a 2- to 4-player tactical card game set on Gloren, a world ravaged by the forces of light and darkness.

Each player controls a warlord — elf, werewolf, or guildmaster — and a fifty-card player deck of supporting heroes, units, items and fortifications from which you build your army. This army can be customized and enhanced with randomized booster packs.

A Fate deck determines the course of play and also the length of the game, whether you use the full fifty-card deck or 25 or 12 cards for shorter games. The Fate deck contains instant event cards, such as wandering monsters, bandits, and player skirmishes, and "add-to-hand" events such as treasures, healing, etc. Players roll d12s for initiative and combat, which adds an additional element of randomness. The goal is to build and strengthen your army before the Final War card is turned over in the Fate deck and all-out battle commences between the players.

Choose your champion and join the Final War!

219565.description: 6 intuition tokens. They are more solid colors, unlike the clear crystal balls in the original game. These are given out during an organized play event.
219565.name: Mysterium: Intuition Tokens

219566.description:
Step into the world of Arkham Horror: The Card Game, and live the madness with the Countless Terrors 1–4 Player Playmat!

Blending the best elements of customizable card games with the best of elements of roleplaying games, Arkham Horror: The Card Game works on many levels to thrust you into the shoes of an investigator exploring a world much larger, darker, and more terrifying than he or she can possibly fathom. Game design and art work conspire to immerse you in the game, and you can add to the experience by playing atop this gorgeous Arkham Horror: The Card Game Playmat.

The Countless Terrors 1–4 Player Playmat measures 26" by 26", large enough for up to four players, to confront all the horrors that await them, and it thrusts them into the spirit of the game by setting those games atop the stunning Core Set cover art by Ignacio Bazán Lazcano. More than that, it circumscribes this iconic art piece within a large and terrifying zodiac, which hints ominously at the true menace of the tentacled terrors from the stars.
219566.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Countless Terrors Playmat

219567.description:
Description from the publisher:

GIANTHOBBY original board game "DORASURE" expansion version 7th bullet!
A new game system to reinforce the story elements "Guardian of Magic Dragon" and 1 additional character!

"Guardian of the Magic Dragon" stopped in front of the adventurer who aims to get rid of the dragon. Can you persuade the dark swordsmen to protect the dragon for the mission of the clan and can both challenge the dragon? The new character "Dusk blade" that appears as "guardian of the dragon" can also be used as a normal additional character.
"DORASURE" is a fully cooperative miniature board game.
219567.name: Dorasure: Guardian of Magic Dragon

219568.name: Everything Makes Sense
219568.description:
Get ready to tell stories like you've never told them before. What's that? Why is this different and just not some marketing ploy? Well, I'll tell you internet friend!

In Everything Makes Sense, you'll be telling stories will all your friends, your family, and even your greatest enemies for story glory!

Games last several rounds or until THE END OF TIME ITSELF. Play until your heart's content. Play for laughs, play to win, play to tell the greatest tale. Play to understand the fundamentals of what it even means to play!

It's up to you.

We're pretty confident things will make sense, otherwise, that would just be awkward.

- How to play -

The game is simple. Each player draws two cards from the Character, Setting, and Plot decks up to a maximum hand size of (6) cards. Whenever you play a card, draw the same card type, always drawing back up to six cards.

The group selects a Story Stickler (judge) who reads off the Theme card, enforces any rules of that card, weights in on the direction of the story if needed, and most importantly awards the points.

Each player plays up to three cards per theme, playing one between the Beginning, Middle, and End of each story. The Player who goes first has the freedom to set up the story however they like, whereas the player who goes last has the power to really end with a bang.

The round ends when all players have played three cards between the Beginning, Middle, and End. The Story Stickler then picks whom the winner is based on whatever they liked from that story. A new Story Stickler is chosen and a new Theme is picked, giving way to a new tale.

Oh! I almost forgot. There's also Plot Twists that can be played anytime to override any card in the story with another card from your hand.

As crazy as stories can get, hopefully... Everything Makes Sense!

219570.name: Aliens (1990)
219570.description:
User Summary
A Run-and-gun game based on the 1986 James Cameron film "Aliens".

219571.name: Battletoads Arcade
219571.description:
User Summary
A scrolling beat 'em up featuring the Battletoads.

219572.name: Crime Fighters 2
219572.description:
User Summary
A scrolling beat 'em up. A censored version was released in the US called Vendetta. Vendetta allowed for 4 players to play simultaneously, but players had to choose the relevant controller to select the character they wanted to play as (just like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles).

219573.name: Judge Dredd (Unreleased)
219573.description:
User Summary

A scrolling beat 'em up game with shooting elements based on the 2000AD comics character and his universe. It includes digitised graphics similar to Mortal Kombat.


This game was scheduled for release in 1992, but was probably never released. Beta copies for MAME are available online that feature a few completed levels.

219574.name: Guerras Gato
219574.description:
Theme: From ancient Egypt to the apocalyptic times of the zombie invasions, going through the Middle Ages and the present age, cats have always sought the supremacy of their counterparts.

In this game each player represents a cat leader who tries to drive away the inhabitants of the regions controlled by their enemies, attacking them ... with cats!

A simple but at the same time very exciting card game that you can use in those moments in which you need to activate your mind.

Goal: To be the last cat leader in the game after having won two of three rounds.

Gameplay: After shuffling the deck of cards, five cards are taken and the player closest to his birthday starts the round.
At each turn a player may use a card to either attack, defend or change sides. If a player can not use a card, he simply passes the turn and waits for the result of the round.

At the end of the round if there are active attack cards, each player will receive a damage card for each attack card on the table, except the last player to play a card.

The player who scores nine points with damage cards loses the round and is eliminated from the game, the last player standing wins the game.

219575.name: Escape Room: The Game – Casino
219575.description:
Expansion for Escape Room: The Game.

The last few years you traveled with your team from casino to casino, from Las Vegas to Monaco and from Atlantic City to Singapore. No trouble in sight till you get a disturbing phonecall in your shabby hotel room.

Carolyn Castle broke the first rule of your styste: Never get Caught!

219577.name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – Wound Deck
219577.description:
The fans of Perdition's Mouth created such an amazing set of extra wounds that Dragon Dawn Productions felt burning need to print all of them.

Using this set of 9 extra wound cards will make the game more difficult, but also more lively.

219579.name: Plezant gezelschap
219579.description: Boardgame like Game of Goose, where you have to collect coasters by solving riddles, while racing to the end of the track. Bottle caps are used as player markers.

219581.name: Magitech Archetypes
219581.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sorcery and Science

Magic and machinery are meet in magnificent ways with this incredible class supplement for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! You'll find seven amazing archetypes that straddle the genres of sci-fi and fantasy, from the astrologer and engram channeler to the necrotech master, robot fighter, and penumbral arcanist! This book also includes a brand-new element for kineticist characters, the machine element, plus over 50 awesome infusions, wild talents, and more, from diesel heart and bloodrust infusion to construct hacker, technograft, mech synthesis,and forced reboot! Plus, new feats for technokineticists and technopaths of every kind! Whether you are adding a dash of sci-fi to your fantasy campaign or exploring a dead and blasted world peopled entirely with lifeless and deathless undead and constructs, you'll find tons of exciting options here for battling robotic overlords, interfacing with alien lostech, and making the power of the machine yours to command! Grab this fantastic 32-page supplement today and Make Your Game Legendary!

219582.name: Strange Aeon Player Edition
219582.description:
From publisher blurb:

That is not dead which can eternal lie and with strange aeons even death may die.
The stars!... The stars are... wrong.

"No. The stars are right. The stars are right at last..."

"Midwich. Now. 1985.

"Seven years have passed and somehow, against all the odds, we few prevail. The ruins of the old town now provides limited shelter against The Morbus and the entities that lurk and murder in the folds of mist, though I use the term shelter with no small cynicism, for truly nowhere on Earth is safe for our kind. Not anymore.

"This is our base, but not our home. We must return, it seems, but only for short periods. Salvation we have found, by sublime irony, within the depths of the very dimensional magic that is no doubt responsible for the fate of our planet.

"Let me explain..."

STRANGE AEON, FREE PLAYER EDITION

A 47 page Strange Aeon lite edition for players or the casually interested! We've removed 300 pages of the Game Keeper specific stuff and left only the crucial information players will need. Just 47 pages with minimal artwork. Printed back to back that's just 23ish pages. A neat self-printed reference for your game group and completely free. This is exactly the same PDF as included with the Game Keeper edition, so if you have that, you already have this, no need to download again.

219583.name: Strange Aeon Game Keeper Edition
219583.description:
From publisher blurb:

That is not dead which can eternal lie and with strange aeons even death may die.
The stars!... The stars are... wrong.

"No. The stars are right. The stars are right at last..."

"Midwich. Then. 1978.

"In those early days, she vibrated with occult activity. Forests fringing the north of the town glowed bright with the light of burning torches. Hooded figures murmured in underground temples. People, unprepared for the rise of eldritch phenomena, were shocked by events that seemed biblical in tone. The police seemed powerless, or somehow snared within a web of occult corruption. A once green and pleasant land was swollen with a deep, unwholesome energy and the air crackled and sparked like a living entity.

"Those were the last days of the Earth. Though we didn't know it at the time; these were the death throes of life as we knew it.

"Did they come from unfathomable voids between the stars? Did they rise from the murky depths of ocean trenches, or oblivion sockets hidden far below ground? Nobody of this time - of the After Years - knows which doom was the one true doom.

"Perhaps all were triggers for armageddon, each playing a part in man's final perdition. Perhaps something else was to blame. It hardly seems relevant in these latter days, when nothing but staying alive consumes our every waking thought.

"We who survive know only that the Earth was transformed and the great works of man obliterated overnight. The mundane - all so firm in its foundations; immovable and vibrant - shifted by degrees and the cities, civilizations, lights and laughter of our world fell away, replaced by the dark... and The Mist.

"In place of our towns and cities came their monoliths, architectures belched forth from the diseased minds of ineffable, unknowable designers. In place of our sprawling society and concrete realms, the earth fell away into pits of empty shadow and spearing mountains of green mold-obsidien, like lime coloured ice lancing into shattered skies. Their mountains. Their skies.

"No builders from an alien realm erected these mausoleum cities. They simply arrived, unfolding from the inner realm of nightmares in ways that made them seem - to those of us who witnessed their coming - as though they had been there all along, patiently awaiting this apocalypse dawn.

"Out of such necropolis towns came tendril mists, rolling like dragon-breath across the fields and downs of our homeland. And from the cold, white gloom came shapes and silhouettes whose very forms were a blasphemy against nature. They writhed, seethed and hissed in their idyll, alpha predators to whom all the world and all worlds were now prey.

"We call it The Morbus. Not a fog but The Fog - a relentless, diseased mist from which nothing escapes. It drifts over the hills and about the roots of those livid, alien mountains. It slides across the grey ruins of our fallen homes and our wastelands alike. It hides Them - the stalking horrors whose piping and hooting portends imminent death and whose all-permeating mould-stench chokes the air with an inescapable reek of decay.

"They are the things that dwell within the mist, born from who dares know where or what. Stealthy, furtive and sly, they slide on slick coils or scrabble on deformed limbs until that moment when prey comes within reach and suddenly all turns to whiplash violence, screams and blood. No more need for creeping. No more need to hide and watch. The nights are always filled with the sound of their feasting.

"Midwich. Now. 1985.

"Seven years have passed and somehow, against all the odds, we few prevail. The ruins of the old town now provides limited shelter against The Morbus and the entities that lurk and murder in the folds of mist, though I use the term shelter with no small cynicism, for truly nowhere on Earth is safe for our kind. Not anymore.

"This is our base, but not our home. We must return, it seems, but only for short periods. Salvation we have found, by sublime irony, within the depths of the very dimensional magic that is no doubt responsible for the fate of our planet.

"Let me explain..."

STRANGE AEON, THE GAME KEEPER EDITION

Contains a 345 page Game Keeper bible with everything the Keeper needs to find players, find somewhere to play, play a game and make it fun. Includes the 47 page player edition so you can print a bunch of references for your group. For the Game Keeper, we've written a guide and a tutor, not a reference manual. With this edition you can play like a master with an easy to learn system, loads of graphical visual aids, three full adventures and a setting at your fingertips. New, unique, terrifying, easy to learn and FUN. Go to www.foreverpeople.co.uk for free goodies, including a bunch more visual aids and printable cards.

219584.name: World Tree
219584.description:
From publisher blurb:

A tree that rivals mountains!

Inside the World Tree:

The history of the Tree and the dryad goddess Endainne who bound herself to it!

The alignment, domains, favored weapon, center of worship, obedience, boons, and tenets of Endainne!

Rules for offspring of the Tree which can enrich any settlement or kingdom!

The history and notable locations in the town of Portkali, Soul of the World Tree!

The daphanie: a race of tribal women botanically augmented by the Tree (and alternate racial traits, favored class options, racial archetypes, toxins, equipment, magic items, and feats for the daphanie)!

The World Tree bestiary containing the Aspect of Endainne, Gnasher (fiendish green dragon), hyeorai (small constructs made of wood), Mjarl the Strong (gargantuan hyeorai), Rattatoskir (awakened flying squirrels), and the Unkindness (doom-bringing raven swarm)!

And a World Tree Random Encounter Table for each of the 4 regions of the Tree!

219585.name: Captain Reginald Gage III: Unwilling Cybersoldier
219585.description:
From publisher blurb:

Captain Gage was a Red Coat in 1774 who encountered a time-traveling probe full of nanobots, which transformed him into a cybernetic killing machine.

The Character Cache is a collection of characters designed to be used in tabletop RPG gaming, either as character concepts for players or as NPCs/villains by GMs. Artist Matt Morrow illustrates the character pieces, and Encoded Designs writes a system-neutral description, including how to incorporate this character into your campaign. These write-ups also include hooks for encounters and adventure inspiration, plus tags for quick reference.

In addition to the system-neutral write-up are stat blocks for:

Fate Core
Savage Worlds
5e

219586.name: A Necromancer's Almanac: 2016
219586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Animate Your Game Today!

A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2016 is a compilation of all the material produced in 2016 for Necromancers of the Northwest’s popular article lines Best in Class, Magic Market, and Exotic Encounters, and Top Ten. With over 180 pages of gaming content, it’s not hard to believe that this book was a full year in the making.

Somehow, we’ve managed to pack nearly 40 combined archetypes, bloodlines, spirits, and other class features, as well as five new base classes tied to specific monstrous races, nearly 120 brand new magic items, plus 25 monsters from CR 1 to 25, six new templates, 25 monster feats, and 5 new player races, plus 40 articles with flavorful content on a variety of topics, all in one single, massive tome of exciting new content for your Pathfinder game. With A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2016, you’ll have all the options to make exactly the character you want.

And what’s more, you don’t have to search through dozens of articles to find it. Everything has been collected, archived, and gathered in an organized fashion. Even better, the digital version boasts not only extensive bookmarking, but also hyperlinked tables and spell lists, allowing you to jump straight to an item, monster, or spell with a single click.

219587.name: The Wildwood
219587.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs face danger and murder when they investigate the sudden viciousness of previously harmless animals and the disappearance of the researcher studying them. Will they unravel the mystery, or become merely additional fertilizer for the great forest?

The Wildwood is a short, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

219588.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 19 - Winter 2017)
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
rpgissuearticle: Looking at the Eorna of Old
The Mechanon Revolt and Its Roots in the Battle of Volkos
Volturnus Before the Day of Doom
219588.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Issue 19 of the Frontier Explorer is now available. This year is the 35th anniversary of Star Frontiers and issue 19 takes us back to where we all started, Volturnus, Planet of Mystery. We have a number of articles looking at equipment, adventures, and background material about the planet.

In addition we have a number of our regular features, more robot articles, a debut article from Robert Murphey (ExileInParadise) that gives us tables for determining your character’s birth world/location based on the planetary population codes in the rules, a few book reviews, and a short fiction piece.

The full article list for this issue is:

Star Frontiers 35th Anniversary
Star Frontiers Birth Locations
Looking at the Eorna of Old
Solving the Star Metal Sickness
Volturnian Psycrystals
The Mechanon Revolt and Its Roots in the Battle of Volkos
Volturnus Before the Day of Doom
The Dralasite Mubobp
Titan Rising: 2299
Drones For Star Frontiers
The Frontier in Miniature: Cybots
Dystopian Futures
General Quarters
Lo, The Rings of Saturn
Grimz Guide Comic

Grab your copy and start exploring!

219589.name: 20 New Traps
219589.description:
Fifth Edition Versions of Some Classics and Some Totally New Devilish Creations

From the introduction:

This document includes the Abyssal gate, acidic fall, crushing room, electrified floor, explosive object, flame jet, grasping arms, hungry insects, log slammer, malicious harpsichord, mists of madness, object of deception, pendulum scythe, poison mister, room filling with water, spectral tendrils, spinning saw blades, widening pit, withering tapestry, and zealous altar traps.

219590.name: 50 New Magic Items
219590.description:
Plus New Common and Cursed Item Properties

From the introduction:

This document includes the following new magic items: angel’s call, bell ringer, belt of hidden knives, belt of the monkey, belt of the scorpion, boomeraxe, boots of the wild, bow of grounding, box of shrinking, bracelet of seduction, breastplate of chaos, cheater’s gloves, dagger of banishing, exploding studded leather, face of distraction, fishscale flippers, flail of force, flying disc, hands of the craftsman, healer’s crossbow, horsemen’s lance, iron net, lashing grip, lightning glaive, pain doll, plate of the red wyrm, radiant chain, razorvine hide, reflecting half plate, ring of the beast, ring of fear, ring of the mighty fist, ring of the vanquished soul, rod of arachna, rod of elements, rod of planar entrapment, rod of tentacles, eyes, and mouths, shoes of the party lord, spy fly, staff of hope, staff of lordly might, staff of the muse, staff of walls, tortoise shell, tracking compass, trailblazer beetles, wand of entertainment, wand of ooze, wand of the weird wizard, and wand of woe. Plus 100 new common weapon properties, 100 new common wondrous items, and 100 new cursed item properties.

219591.name: Wonderful Weapons and Exotic Equipment
219591.description:
A collection of weapons and equipment options for those that want a little bit more.

Publisher's blurb:

Wondrous Weapons and Exotic Equipment contains a small compilation of weapons that fill a few of the niches that are yet to be filled up, the trick weapons of Bloodborne and some minor defensive upgrades such as the Buckler, the Tower Shield, Thieves Mail for those that wish to stealth and be well defended and two bits of equipment that allow Barbarians, Monks and Wizards to have some semblance of defensive garb that isn't really armor.

219592.name: The Nephilim
219592.description:
Progeny of Lilith; Stain on Celestial Honor; Dirty Little Secret of the Fiends; Keepers of the Balance; Nomads of the Multiverse

Publisher's blurb:

The Nephilim brings the half-celestial, half-fiend children of the Lady Lilith into the fold. This particular version details them as different aspects depending on which Firstborn they follow: Absalom, Death, Fury, Strife or War.

Also within is a new sub-type for existing races to have a small bit of Nephilim glory within their veins. It also includes a small number of racial feats that pertain to this race, their hybrids and a bit more.

219593.name: Oath of the Annointed Slayer
219593.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Oath of the Anointed Slayer is a new paladin build that brings with it a few new abilities and tweaks to some he already has.

His effectiveness as the team healer through Lay On Hands is reduced [as is] his Cleansing Touch, but he makes up for it with enhanced casting and a slew of neat new tools to help him hunt his quarry.

219594.description:
Description from the publisher:

Paris 1800' invites you to relive the XIXth century in Paris with its great figures, Romantic and Modern, to decide the future planning of the capital. Moderns transform the city by expanding its boulevards, creating monuments in iron and glass and restoring order. Romantics want to preserve the old quarters of bourgeois ambitions using the dissatisfaction of the people of Paris and inspiring them with revolutionary ideas.

Paris 1800' is an assymetrical game in which the objective is to have more victory points at the end of play (1910) or reach 20 VP at any moment.
In each round the players:
1 : collect Resources (Inspiration points or Millions of francs)
2 : move character(s), according to the Observatory
3 : perform an action (one per character)

The Romantics score by making Revolutions, finding and stopping the Engineer from transforming districts and writing in Exile. They can also trigger Unrest in the districts (Discontent and Revolt), get inspiration in the Forest and liberate a Romantic from the Fort.

Moderns score by transforming Faubourgs, Ville and Cité districts. Their actions are draw Projects, obtain/change Permit, Restore order and Imprison a Romantic.

Both camps are able to open/close the newspaper and to change the movement order in the Observatory.

Bribe: When a Prefect tries to put a Romantic in the Fort, he can use one a Bribe marker to avoid being locked up, but the Moderns immediately gain 2 million francs.

Calculation and treason cards: only valid in a three-player situation.

Each player draws two "Calculation and Treason" cards. Between 1825 and 1850, at any moment, every player secretly holds one card in hand. From 1850, if a player is a renegade, he will have to discreetly help the other camp.

After 1850 loyal players can denounce a suspected renegade. If the player is indeed a renegade, he stops play and joins the other camp (the game is still a 3v3 pawns). If he's not a renegade, the camp loses immediately 5 VP.
219594.name: Paris 1800' (second edition)

219595.name: Character Focused Random Events for the City
219595.description:
From the introduction:

The [included system and] tables represent a way to generate random events while visiting a city between adventures. In an effort to make these events more personally interesting to unique characters, I’ve created a D100 table that can be altered to fit any combination of the standard Races, Classes, and Backgrounds found in the Player's Handbook (D&D 5e).

219596.name: Curious Backgrounds
219596.description:
Prince(ss), Seeker, Tinker, and Visionary

From the introduction:

Personality traits, ideals, bonds, flaws and features for four new backgrounds, including additional optional features which change how a character is played.

219597.name: D&D 5e Rules on a Page
219597.description:
Author's blurb:

Every important D&D rule on a single page! Includes:


Weapon & Equipment Restrictions
Movement
Combat Actions
Spell Mechanics
Conditions
Skills
General Gameplay

219598.name: The Sigil System Stealth Mod
219598.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The stealth rules are all very simple and is based around the Awareness Scale, which serves to turn whatever compound (be it a castle, a bank, a star ship) into an entity against which you are competing with to remain hidden. The Awareness Scale represents the compound's mood and allow the GM to have the NPCs inside the compound react accordingly to what you, the player, is doing.

As to what the player is doing, they'll be trying to raise hell as quietly as possible, while their actions (both narrative and through Skill Checks) will raise their Awareness Level along the Scale, while time and the use of the Sigils meta-currency hope to bring it back down.

If you've ever wanted to try your luck and skills at sneaking through an entire area, skulking around where you shouldn't be, and taking down enemies before they reach you, well we got the Mod for you.

219599.name: The Glyph Stealth Mod
219599.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The stealth rules are all very simple and is based around the Awareness Scale, which serves to turn whatever compound (be it a castle, a bank, a star ship) into an entity against which you are competing with to remain hidden. The Awareness Scale represents the compound's mood and allow the GM to have the NPCs inside the compound react accordingly to what you, the player, is doing.

As to what the player is doing, they'll be trying to raise hell as quietly as possible, while their actions (both narrative and through Skill Checks) will raise their Awareness Level along the Scale, while time and the use of the Sigils meta-currency hope to bring it back down.

If you've ever wanted to try your luck and skills at sneaking through an entire area, skulking around where you shouldn't be, and taking down enemies before they reach you, well we got the Mod for you.

219600.name: Icewinds Wild Magic
219600.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Presents your players with an additional Wild Magic Surge Table, as it is featured within the official Player's Handbook. This particular Wild Magic Table seeks to present a cold-focused variant to the standard options.

Because of its focus, this table is great for nearly any setting, and perfect for the cold environments of the Sword Coast in the Forgotten Realms, or to emphasize the cold valley-weather of Ravenloft's Barovia.

219601.name: Jeweled Thrones of the Earth
219601.description:
Publisher blurb:

HITHER CAME CONAN THE CIMMERIAN, BLACK-HAIRED, SULLEN-EYED, SWORD IN HAND, A THIEF, A REAVER, A SLAYER, WITH GIGANTIC MELANCHOLIES AND GIGANTIC MIRTH, TO TREAD THE JEWELED THRONES OF THE EARTH UNDER HIS SANDALLED FEET.

Jeweled Thrones of the Earth presents six complete and ready-to-play adventures for Robert E. Howard’s Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of. Within these pages gamemasters will find the means to take heroes across the whole of Conan’s world.

Explore a lost city in the steaming jungles of the south and dare to face the Feathered Ape, as well as other menaces in Devils Among Green Stars.
Sail across the eons to an island enthralled by a demon-goddess, and attempt to escape the hand of fate in The Pact of Xiabalba.
Seek unimaginable wealth within The Caves of the Dero, whose denizens harbor a terrifying secret.
Defend the frontier against an attack by Picts, spurred to war by an ancient evil known only as The Ghost of Thunder River.
Discover the secrets of a sinister thief-cult hidden within the heart of a city, watched over by The Thousand Eyes of Aumag-Bel.
Fight slavers in a desperate battle to win freedom and escape the horrors of The Red Pit.
Uncover a degenerate race lost to the desert and time, in The Seethers in the Sand.
Guidelines for linking these adventures together into complete campaigns.
Scattered Jewels… a dozen exciting adventure seeds to help spur further exploits.




Written using Modiphius’ 2d20 system, these ready-to-use adventures for include new monsters and foes suitable for any Conan game: ranging from horrific crawlers, giant-king skeleton warriors, the Worm Within, cave horrors, the monstrous Watcher, the mighty a’ghama, and the degenerate saurian descendants of the ancient serpent-folk.

All this… and more!

219602.name: Le Billard Finlandais
219602.description:
Le Billard Finlandais is a handmande woodgame with a elastic strap shooting device.

The players use a shooting device to shoot a wooden disk and to try to knock over wooden pins, which are marked with numbers from 1 to 12. The pins are initially placed in a tight group in an upright position. Knocking over one pin scores the amount of points marked on the pin. Knocking 2 or more pins scores the number of pins knocked over. After each throw, the pins are stood up again in the exact location where they landed. The first one to reach exactly 50 points wins the game. Scoring more than 50 will be penalised by setting the player's score back to 25 points. A player will be eliminated from the game if they miss all of the target pins three times in a row.

219603.name: D&D 5e Player Cheet Sheet
219603.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DMs have their reference screens, why shouldn't the player have theirs?

If you're just getting started with D&D 5e then this is the crucial item to help you learn the game. If you're a seasoned pro then this may not be for you but it might help you remember all those little bits.
...
Print it out and study it while waiting for your turn!

219605.name: Battle Formations
219605.description:
From the introduction:

Warfare is a staple in most fantasy stories. A huge lot of them like to depict vast armies stretching across the horizon, arrows flying across the sky, massive phalanxes clashing with shield walls and heroic cavalry charges. Although D&D is a game focused on small groups of characters, such epic conflicts are an awesome resource for adventures. Because the battlefield is a nasty and turbulent place, the characters can be thrust into new situations and new dangers at a moment’s notice.

219606.name: Rest In Peace
219606.description:
User Summary

You herd balls into a cube using lines that you draw. Sometimes there are aids like red squares that teleport balls or arrows that move balls in certain directions. There are even hazards -- like birds -- to avoid. There are only 18 levels, taking about 10-15 minutes to complete.

219607.name: Bushido: Wamu
219607.description: Another worm to emerge from the perilous, relentless training of the Kaze Kage Zoku, Wamu is a swift and nimble novice assassin. Like her fellow novice Wamu is able to employ the teachings of her mentors to great effect. A competent warrior and a promising student of the ways of the ninja.

219608.description: Ten high quality, 16mm faction dice for use with the Bushido - New Dawn miniatures strategy game.
219608.name: Bushido: Kage Kaze Zoku Faction Dice

219610.name: Four Colors al Fresco Quickstart
219610.description:
From the introduction:

Four Colors al Fresco is a roleplaying game of pulp-style
adventure, set in an alternate Renaissance. The basic setting
is Renaissance Italy – as it might have been.

User summary:

Several variations of the basic quickstart guide were provided by the publisher. These were distributed as free downloads.

219611.name: Four Colors al Fresco Character Sheet
219611.description:
User summary:

This character sheet was provided as a free download, intended for print-and-play use. Several minor variations were offered at different times.

219612.name: High Stakes
219612.description:
Subtitle: A Storytelling Adventure Game for 2 or more players

From the publisher's website:

High Stakes is a new storytelling system by Ganesha Games. With High Stakes, you can create characters in minutes and start telling stories and living their adventures with almost no preparation. You'll need just a bunch of six-sided dice, pen and paper, and plenty of imagination. Watch out for the High Stakes Hackbook coming from Ganesha Games and other publishers later in 2017.

And text in the free, light version:

This is the free, light version (without any art or background material) of High Stakes. It contains the full system, allowing you try the rules in a setting of your own devising. These rules are constantly updated. Make sure you download the latest version. If you like it, you may purchase one of the Hackbooks produced for High Stakes. The Hackbooks reprint the core rules (so you have to carry around only one book or file) and add plenty of ready-made settings, story hooks, interesting characters, genre tropes, and ideas to create your stories.

This is a living rulebook and will be updated from time to time.

219613.name: Four Colors al Fresco Pre-Generated Characters
219613.description:
User summary:

Numerous pre-generated characters were provided as free download documents from the publisher's site. Most were intended for non-player character use, pre-generated character use, or character creation examples. However, all were game legal for whatever use needed. They were all presented as one-page print-and-play components on the standard character sheet.

The twenty-seven generated character include Agatha "Tinker" Jordano, Amiga Castanaveras, The Cardinal, Chrysalis, Cricket, The Daedalean Peregrine, Dragonfly, Firefly, Frog, Gargoyle, Gibraltar, Golem the Savage Thunder, Guiseppi d'Ual, Leyden, Moth, The Mystic Rose, The Navigator, Perspex, Pillbug, Rego Aquam, Renaissance Man, Spider, The Spook, Tabula Rasa the Waxman, Whirling Dervish, and Zephyr.

219614.name: Four Colors al Fresco Worksheets
219614.description:
User summary:

Numerous game master worksheets (play aids) were provided as free download documents from the publisher's site. Most were intended for print-and-play use. The sheets include:


Mastermind Sheet
Sorcerous Might
Title Sheet
Villain Sheet
Character Sheet
World Map

219615.description:
Description from the publisher:

The raccoons are out of control. They’ve diversified into many different forms, morphing into all manner of styles. In Raccoon Madness, you’ll have to be good at bluffing in order to get rid of your cards. Will another player call your bluff?

Players that have no cards won!

Every day we have to decide whether to tell the truth or to tell a lie; sometimes we are afraid of being deceived and we feel ashamed whenever we are caught in a lie. To train our intuition and to enhance our emotion reading skills in a fun environment, we have created “Raccoon Madness Game”.

This game was created by three friends. We have been inspired by Tim Burtons art, old USSR game and Texas Holdem Poker.
219615.name: Raccoon Madness Game

219616.description:
There are shadowy plots at work in London, beyond even those of the sinister Cult of Imhotep and its Agents. Ancient forces, who view the smog choked streets and its corrupted masses as anathema to the natural balance of the world, have arisen in the heart of London.

These are the followers of The Wheel.

Calling forth primal magics, this band of gypsies, witches, and fay now seek to cleanse this black spot from the natural realm- by any means necessary.

The Wheel, an expansion for the game The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch, brings a new missions to Rise of Moloch and comes with:

2 Heroes (Reverend Dudley and Mrs. Dudley);
4 Agents (Nibaba, Baba Yaga the Witch, Divio Juckal and Cobblestone Golem);
1 New Minion x8 (The Night Creatures);
Tiles
219616.name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – The Wheel

219617.name: Die For You
219617.description:
From the introduction:

Growing up is weird. Every time you think you understand where you are and what you’re doing, it all changes. Get used to middle school, suddenly you’re in high school. Figure out your place in high school, then you get sent off to college. And college, well, college is the deep end. Until you finally push through it and have to find a job. Along the way, you have to choose what – and, more importantly, who – matters most to you.

Die For You is a roleplaying game about all of that, and also monsters.

219618.description:
With Quadropolis: Public Services, an expansion for the Quadropolis base game, players can add new public service buildings to their cities. As Mayor, will they choose to increase the population by building a maternity ward or protect their citizens with a new police station? Perhaps a reprocessing plant would be a good investment to decrease pollution... Whatever you choose, competition will be fierce, and being able to build the right public service at the right time will not be made easy by the other players.

Each round, a selection of public service tiles are revealed and placed face up next to the board. Players will then be able to build these in their city, with each of these new buildings offering in-game bonuses and scoring options to newly challenge you as Mayor of a modern city.
219618.name: Quadropolis: Public Services
boardgamepodcastepisode: 27. Devon Dice Podcast: The Balancing Act: Assassins, Beasts, Children, Designers
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers

219619.name: Ants Around Ansberg
219619.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The party arrives in the quiet frontier town of Ansberg to find it under siege by giant ants. With the guards fully occupied depending the town, it is up to the party to follow the ants back to their nest and put an end to the threat.

This adventure has a focus on combat, with some skill checks and traps, and can be used with any setting.

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

219620.name: Rebel Times (Issue 112 - Jan 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Karciane Nowości - Macki I Substytut Kości
Przetrwać w Arktyce i nie zwariować

219621.name: Walk the Plank! (Deluxe Edition)
boardgameimplementation: Walk the Plank! Ghost Meeple Mini-Expansion
219621.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Walk the Plank!, players represent the worst pirates in a captain's crew. The captain has rounded you all up because you're all lazy and stupid and simply not worth the rum and loot you get paid. That said, the captain has decided he's willing to keep two of you in his crew. To prove you're worthy, you will fight amongst yourselves, trying to shove other players' pirates off the end of the plank while keeping yours alive!

In game terms, each round players secretly stack three of their ten action cards, then they take turns revealing and playing those actions one by one no matter what's gone wrong between the planning and the doing. If you plan to have a pirate shove someone off the plank on your third move and all he sees are his own best mates, he will still shove away! Some cards bear a skull on them, and these powerful cards must remain on the table the round after they're played, but otherwise players then pick up their action cards and start a new round. As soon as two or fewer pirates remain on board, the game ends and the owner (or owners) of these pirates win! Watch out, though, as sometimes every pirate will end up in the drink, which means that no one wins other than the sharks circling in the water below...

This all new deluxe tin edition features a reworked version of the rules, all new artwork (by Felideus Bubastis), screen printed meeples, and the Ghost Meeple mini-expansion (with rules).

219622.name: Walk The Plank! (Limited Edition)
boardgameimplementation: Walk the Plank! Ghost Meeple Mini-Expansion
219622.description:
In Walk the Plank!, players represent the worst pirates in a captain's crew. The captain has rounded you all up because you're all lazy and stupid and simply not worth the rum and loot you get paid. That said, the captain has decided he's willing to keep two of you in his crew. To prove you're worthy, you will fight amongst yourselves, trying to shove other players' pirates off the end of the plank while keeping yours alive!

In game terms, each round players secretly stack three of their ten action cards, then they take turns revealing and playing those actions one by one no matter what's gone wrong between the planning and the doing. If you plan to have a pirate shove someone off the plank on your third move and all he sees are his own best mates, he will still shove away! Some cards bear a skull on them, and these powerful cards must remain on the table the round after they're played, but otherwise players then pick up their action cards and start a new round. As soon as two or fewer pirates remain on board, the game ends and the owner (or owners) of these pirates win! Watch out, though, as sometimes every pirate will end up in the drink, which means that no one wins other than the sharks circling in the water below...

This all new limited edition tin edition features a reworked version of the rules, all new artwork (by Felideus Bubastis), screen printed meeples, the Ghost Meeple mini-expansion (with rules), and a 26 card promo pack.

The promo pack features a summary card and 5x cards each each of the five player colors, which now give each player 15 cards to choose from rather than the 10 cards featured in the original or the deluxe tin editions.

The new cards are:

Skeleton
Scallywag
Parlay
Ghost Pirate
Dynamite

219624.name: Cleric Domains
219624.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing eight new domain options for your 5th edition cleric:

Beauty
Community
Doomsday
Frost
Moon
Time
Travel
Volcano




Each path offers new features and options for your cleric. Cleric Domains offers a wealth of divine inspiration.

219625.name: Bizarre Monstrosities
219625.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has many official monsters, but many creatures we loved in prior editions have been overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 6 new, low-challenge monstrosities: Crabman; Dust Digger; Hippocampus; Kamadan; Kech; Manbat.

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

219626.name: Beta-Max Dome
219626.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FULLY-ILLUSTRATED FULL-COLOR 14 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN – CONTAINING 20+ SEPERATE LOCATION ENCOUNTERS AND RANDOM ENCOUNTERS. INCLUDES SAMPLE LOW-LEVEL CHARACTERS READY FOR PLAY. Beta-Dome is a pretty paranoid place – what with all the terrorists on the loose. Then there are the spray-can vandals. And don't go down into the sewers of Beta-Dome with the genetic terrors down there. There are aliens and robots – the robots are the worst. The alarms going off all the time and berserk joggers. It's not even safe to go to the bathroom. Then there are the rabid replicants. Keep your sputter-gun handy …

219627.name: Odin's Wild Hunt of Paris
219627.description:
From publisher blurb:

'UNEARTHLY BEINGS' APPEAR OVER PARIS, FRANCE, KILL MANY.

By Jim Goldman 13/11/2015

-AAP, REUTERS

Confused reports continue to filter out of Paris, France, where reportedly long-dead Scandinavian Gods have made an appearance during Odin's 'Wild Hunt' of Yule. Ghostly apparitions have been successfully engaged by military jets of the French National Airforce over the skies of Paris during confused ground fighting with suspected ISIS suicide units somehow in religious conjunction with these religious figures.

French ground units continue to battle ground units in restaurants and theaters around Paris as civilians stream out of the city center.

Beginning at 21:20 CET, three suicide bombers struck near the Stade de France in Saint-Denis, followed by suicide bombings and mass shootings at cafés, restaurants and a music venue in central Paris.

The attackers have killed 100 people, including 60 at the Bataclan theatre, where they took hostages before engaging in a continuing stand-off with police.

Yule has traditionally been the time of Odin and Freya's 'Wild Hunt' where the Norse god and goddess range across the sky gathering souls for his Army of the Dead at The End of Time. Reputedly, anyone outdoors is liable to be slain ...

A FULLY-ILLUSTRATED FULL-COLOR 17 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN – CONTAINING CITY-WIDE SEPERATE LOCATION ENCOUNTERS AND RANDOM ENCOUNTERS. INCLUDES SAMPLE MID-LEVEL MUTANT AND REPLICANT SUPERHERO AND GOD AND GODDESS CHARACTERS READY FOR PLAY.

219628.name: One Blazing Easter!
219628.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Labyrinth Lord/Mutant Future Free AD&D retro-clone. On 2 April 2015, gunmen stormed the Garissa University College in Garissa, Kenya, killing at least 147 people, and injuring 79 or more. The militant group Al-Shabaab, which the gunmen claimed to be from, took responsibility for the attack. The gunmen took several students hostage, freeing Muslims but holding Christians. The siege ended the same day after four gunmen were killed. The attack was the deadliest in Kenya since the 1998 United States embassy bombings. It had more casualties than the 2013 Westgate shopping mall attack in Nairobi, Kenya. Garissa, around 200km from the Somalian border, was previously considered as "one of the safest spots in the region", and housed both military barracks and police headquarters. Since Islamic Courts Union were routed by Ethiopian-led forces, Al-Shabaab has been in conflict with Kenyan-led AMISOM troops. Uganda has also faced Al-Shabaab attacks. Now with sample contemporary military characters and super hero mutant characters for Mutant Future as response teams ... Can you stop the impending anarchy and save the day ?!?

219629.name: Planet of the Nephilim
219629.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FULLY-ILLUSTRATED 116 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN – PLANET OF THE NEPHILIM – An adventure for 5-6 modern Labyrinth Lord / Mutant Future player characters of 10-12th level totalling 60 levels. The crew of the Galaxy Voyager have crashed landed on the planet Nephilim. The giants there genetically have weak senses and are officious, oafish, ignorant dullards. They are also insufferable cowards and sexually licentious (despite, surprisingly, their low-birth rate and ruthless State-enforced biological infanticide campaigns for 'Those Unfit For Life'). Their low-birthrate and survival unto adulthood combines with their cowardice to make them reluctant to close for combat. However, they will always attempt to capture human earthlings due to fascist government directives and they fear their tyrannical police state more than their natural and selfish instincts. The capture policy is because the planet of Nephilim has spied Earth and its tiny Earthmen across space and are greedy for Earth's water and resources but lack the sufficient technology in space travel to get there. The fascist giant government sees it as imperative to capture the lost humans' small spacecraft to use their miniaturisation and macro- and retro-engineering on to gain space flight They have gluttonous appetites that will distract them easily. Average Nephilim may lift their own body weight and carry it at normal movement encumbrance Giant society has a fiat, non-precious metal and paper currency and does not favour the use of precious metals or jewels to enhance themselves which they see as garish and effete. The giants speak a form of English that is distinctly flavoured unto itself with a slur. S.I.G. is a world government and there are different races of Nephilim of different colouration and racial abilities. Nephilim live to the age of 140 years but suffer dementia by 120 years. Nephilim is ruled over by a tyrannical bureaucracy known as 'The S.I.G.' ("Signals Intelligence Group").
