S.I.G. members, known as Inquisitors, wear sharp and stylish black leather coats and leggings with paramilitary insignia and trench coats. The S.I.G. has the fascist and corporatist leash on life and death over the other Nephilim inhabitants of the planet who are too slovenly and stupid to stir or revolt. Instead they revel in being subjected to despotism where oppression is a cultural meme. Surveillance is central to this society where each Nephilim is constantly informing on the activities and suspected activities of his fellows. An old Nephilim witticism goes: "Why didn't anyone on Nephilim see last night's Inquisitor-General's report on the synth-box? Because they were all out checking in their neighbours' windows to see if they were dutifully watching the broadcast ...". The levels of suspicion created by Nephilim society is positively overheated and paranoid. Includes sample character personalities from the television series ready for play.

219630.name: Radioactive Queens of the Everglades
219630.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FULLY-ILLUSTRATED 74 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN – CONTAINING 169 SEPERATE LOCATION ENCOUNTERS. INCLUDES SAMPLE LOW-LEVEL CHARACTERS AND VEHICLES READY FOR PLAY. After The Fall, the supra-state of Oceania fell into chaos – particularly the ex-nation of the United States of America. The profuse use of nuclear weapons on the continent saturated the topsoil with radioactive fallout while the toxic poison of chemical weapons residue combined with biological agent horrors to twist the remain population. Those who could descended underground. In the Florida Everglades still not swept away by erosion from Atlantic Storms, various Military “Villes” exist in underground buildings. These Villes, commanded by the legendary “Alphaville”, attempt to enforce law and order on the wilds of the Everglades, particularly the Underground Trogs that inhabit caves here. The Villes are armed with various military robots to defend their subterranean bases against the wild Trogs and the other creatures of the the stinking bog. Some of these deadly robots patrol the horrid fen hunting down the vermin and Trogs and putting them to the laser. Meanwhile the lizard-like Trogs continue to breed with high birth rates and attempt to out-strip the populations of the remaining humans who cannot replace their numbers fast enough. The Trogs attempt to capture humans for feasting, sacrifice and perverse breeding with human females for Half-Humans / Half-Trogs. They attack and burn local human communities that have largely descended to a technology level somewhere between the 14th century and the 19th century with steam and coal as limited resource energy. The Military Villes are the only complexes still in commission from the former world in this area.

219631.name: Razor Runner
219631.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Labyrinth Lord/Mutant Future AD&D free retro-clone. Over 70 random encounters in the partially destroyed city of L.A. in the Central Basin of California, detailing the blasted outskirts and towers of the Tyrantis Megacorp including labs, apartments, defensive strong points and common areas to mention a few. Trade with the mohawked and tattooed street vendors of hazardous downtown L.A. or vye with the scrap merchants of Sacremento who have just blown into the city to dispose of extra credits. Most importantly, hunt down the rogue team of Beta Replicants bent upon a suicide mission somewhere in the Tyrantis Megacorp complex before time runs out ... !

219632.name: Spacemen & Aliens
219632.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete ability skill system built upon Labyrinth Lord and Mutant Future allowing G.M.s and players to run characters stretching from rustic barbarians to secret agents to space admirals. All adventurer types from all time zone catered for including aliens, mutants, replicants and robots. Full ability skill descriptions with LL/MF game mechanics. Secret underground standing. Robot construction and cost. Mutant Future technology and weapon costs. Sample characters. 17 pages of solid typed information comprising an expansion to Labyrinth Lord and Mutant Future. Fully compatible with first edition Advanced Dungeons and Dragons.

219633.name: The Irminsul of Aphrodite-Ammut
219633.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Labyrinth Lord/Mutant Future AD&D free retro-clone. This adventure takes place around an enormous Irminsul-Yggdrasil World Oak Tree in an impenetrable forest. Around the tree is wound an enormous wurm (worm) which spiritually imbues the Land of this region. The maps contained below of the tree are cross-sections of the hollow tree (containing passages and rooms) at various height points up its trunk above ground (consider the tree had been laterally sawn in half and felled to reveal this view at its various floor heights about ground level). The main focus of this adventure is the lordess of the Irminsul Tree, Lady Fata Aphrodite-Ammut, an avatar of Eris Discordia – the Greek goddess of Primordial Chaos. She resides within the tree and controls the surrounding forest. She is served by various denizen within the rooms of the hollow tree such as the Vegepygmies. This adventure scenario is designed for 4-6 player characters of class levels 10th to 15th. The adventuring party should include a cleric, a magic user and a thief. Also compatible with AD&D.

219634.name: The Spinning Statuette of Cydonia
219634.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FULLY-ILLUSTRATED 80 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN –

THE SPINNING STATUETTE OF CYDONIA – This contemporary campaign is designed for 2-5 players of 1st to 3rd level totalling 5-6 levels of characters in a party. From a museum in Manchester to the Giza Plateau to the Martian Plains – what is the secret to the spinning statuette of Cydonia. The primordial Egyptian god of Death, Set, seeks to reconquer Earth with his rocket bombs. Can the characters stop him ??? From suicidal aircraft to the rank prisons of Cairo – what depths will the characters plumb? Full maps and details of the Cairo and English Legal and Penal systems and underground black market. Random encounters. Details of the surface of the planet Mars. Details to the Martian temple of Set and his malign plans.

219635.name: The Wrath of Solrac Votan
219635.description:
From publisher blurb:

52 pages of full-color photographs, maps, illustrations and details of the Pyramids of Mexico, UFOs in flight over the Pyramids, details of alien spacecraft, space drugs, the Mexican Army, subterranean dinosaurs and a massive cyst beneath the Mexican Pyramid plateau. For Labyrinth Lord/Mutant Future Free AD&D retro-clone. An adventure for 2-5 modern characters level 9-20 totaling 40-45 levels (Sample characters with full equipment included). June 20th, 2016 A.D.: Over 3,000 tourists are killed at Teotihuacan by a blinding, searing light. The bodies remain bleaching in the sun, unable to be recovered by authorities. What is the mystery of Teotihuacan and its strange ziggurats dedicated to Solrac Votan??? On June 20th as over 3,000 visitors crowded the Avenue of the Dead of the Teotihuacan, the solar god of the Votan – Solrac Votan – returned in a burning, incinerating intervention. Solrac Votan, god of the Votans, immediately inhabited the Temple of the Sun in its lower chambers and began his cosmic countdown: in exactly 6 months Solrac Votan will burst from the ziggurat and rampage across the Earth, destroying it with the additional powers he has meanwhile gained. With the solar intervention of Solrac Votan on the Avenue of the Dead at Teotihuacan on the June 20th solstice, Mexican military authorities established a 6 mile radius cordon perimeter around the site. No one will be allowed to enter this cordon except the player character party who have been assembled secretly by the Mexican government to penetrate the site and discover what is going on. The characters will be allowed to penetrate this military cordon freely to attempt to enter the various pyramidal step ziggurats that dot the site of Teotihuacan.

219636.name: Threads
219636.description:
From publisher blurb:

A FULL-COLOR 45 PAGE LABYRINTH LORD/MUTANT FUTURE CAMPAIGN FOR 5 CHARACTERS OF FIRST LEVEL – THREADS is a post-nuclear apocalyptic campaign for Mutants & Mazes (Labyrinth Lord and Mutant Future) It puts forth a post-Armageddon global scenario where a catastrophic atomic exchange known only as ‘The Social Wars’ has taken place sometime in the 2020s AD. The campaign’s beginning date is what is suspected to be (and has been ordained by the surviving elites) the 1st of January, 2080 AD. A shattered civilization reels on its knees to regain its balance. A world thrust inexplicably into a technological Dark Ages of the 600s-1200s AD. MIRVed ballistic missiles replaced with wooden and stone clubs. Electricity: a mystical wonder of the perhaps-magical elite. Mutation and desolation. A neo-feudalism descends on Earth… Details are sketchy in the physical remnants of libraries and media outlets hit hard in the prolonged nuclear exchange now referred to as ‘The Social Wars’. These occurred around 2020 AD though no one now is even exactly sure of what is the correct date. The correct date as per the now-operational UKBC is set at January 1st, 2080 AD (United Kingdom Broadcasting Center which is again kept broadcasting constantly in the prospect should any of the now-lost ex-British N-sub flotilla ever re-crew, reactivate, find no signal, loose its missiles and restart a limited nuclear exchange with “The Combine”). ‘Yew-Kay-Bee-See’ (actually UKBC - the transmissions and bunker area of the UKBC, the United Kingdom’s Broadcasting Centre, 60 miles north of Old London) - cult among Commoners and primitives with radio access. The monotone broadcaster voice (computer-generated) for the radio network that can reach most of the UK with a signal is regarded as god-like to some in the UK and is manipulated by UNIT and the remnant State. Contains the adventures The Fury of the Danes and The Risen City of Atlantis. Also contains suitable sample First Level characters for the campaign ready for play. Contains rules for technology, weapon proficiencies and a chronology of Armageddon.

219637.name: Basher Science Card Game
219637.description:
From the publisher:
"Based on the delightful Basher Science Book Series, Basher Science toys and games show kids that science is fascinating and fun! The Basher Science Card Game is 2 games in 1 — play battle or match with fun science facts! The base game includes 22 colorful cards that teach kids about various topics such as liquid, pollen, and sandstone, from different branches of science, plus a mini-figure and 2 tokens for game play. Basher Science Card Games are available in these science subjects: Rocks & Minerals, Biology, Astronomy, and Chemistry. Collect Basher Science Mini-Figure singles and 3-packs for exclusive game cards with special powers! For ages 6 and up
Features:
• Learning about science is big fun with Basher Science!
• The Basher Science Card Game is 2 games in 1—play battle or match with fun science facts!
• Each character card teaches facts about an aspect of science (such as atom, virus, and supernova) and includes a special power for use during game play
• When you purchase the Basher Science mini-figures, look for exclusive cards that can also be used in the game
• Pack includes 24 colorful cards that teach kids about topics from different branches of science. Also includes a mini-figure and 2 tokens for game play
• Collect the game for each science branch and have a blast as you learn!"

Further details:
The base game is a small box of 22 cards (2 copies of 11 different cards) and a single Shopkins-like figure. There are four base boxes: Biology, Chemistry, Astronomy and Rocks & Minerals. Additionally, there are 3-packs and 1-packs. These come with three or 1 Shopkin-like figures and 2 copies of their associated cards. Each pack is also themed Biology, Chemistry, Astronomy and Rocks & Minerals.

Battle Game:
Before the game starts, each player builds an 8-card deck. Each card has a value between 1 and 8, a name, a small fact, and a game-play ability. Cards from different themes can be mixed. Players draw a hand of three cards from their decks. They then simultaneously choose one and reveal it. The higher number wins the round. Special powers will break rules and make things interesting. The player who first wins 4 rounds (short game) or 6 rounds (long game) wins the game.

219638.name: Donner Dinner Party
219638.description:
Donner Dinner Party is a rowdy game of frontier cannibalism!

Who's safe when there are cannibals hiding among you? That's the question at the heart of this fast-paced game of social deduction in which cannibals and pioneers face off in a fight for survival. Set in the winter of 1846, players are members of the ill-fated Donner Party wagon train, stranded atop a mountain with no food. Who will avoid becoming tonight's dinner and make it off the mountain alive? And who are the suspicious scoundrels hungry for human flesh?

In more detail, Donner Dinner Party is a social deduction game in which players are either pioneer or cannibal. Each player has equipment as well, and sometimes that will help you survive — unless of course you're a cannibal, in which case you might want to play dumb about what you have.

The party goes hunting regularly to try to survive, and the cannibals will try to thwart these efforts since they really prefer the taste of human flesh. In the end, if the number of cannibals equals the number of pioneers, the cannibals win; if the pioneers survive seven weeks without this happening, then they win instead.

219639.name: Hey Girl, Hey
219639.description:
From the publisher:

A Little Game of Consensual Stupidity

Play literally starts with this question "Hey Girl Hey, would it be ok with you if I made some stupid jokes about a serious issue?" The goal is to make each other laugh. That's it. No points, no scoring; just jokes. Players simply throw out the most absurdest pick up lines they can think of. "Real" pick up lines are gross, so be careful you don't just sound like a creep. Be weird. Be funny. Don't be serious. This is fun and stupid and totally making fun of the entire idea of pick up lines.

The most important rule is that all participants are having a great time. There are no turns or requirements; a player can say one line or one hundred or none at all. Just don't talk all over each other.

The safe word is "I'm not interested" If you're playing and ever feel like you need it to end for any reason, say "I'm not interested" and everyone must immediately stop playing, check if you're ok, and without any grumbling, questioning, or convincing, completely change the subject to anything other than this stupid game and move on.

Examples to get you going:
Hey girl hey,
...what's your favorite type of triangle?
...do you believe in gravity?
...what's super effective against grass type?
...who was the weakest Pope?

219640.name: Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind
videogameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
219640.description:
User Summary

Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind is a dlc for Elder Scrolls Online, featuring the area of Vvardenfell, the isle in the game Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind. The main mission will be to save Morrowind by stoping a meteor from crashing into Vivec City by helping a demi-god regain his lost powers. There will also be a new class: Warden.

219641.name: InfinitasDM
219641.description:
From publisher blurb:

InfinitasDM is an Atlas, Lorebook, Battle Map, digital RPG tabletop all in one. All completely game-system agnostic for any genre and any RPG system.
Unlike other "digital tabletops," InfinitasDM takes the power of digital tools and brings them to the physical table. Create and control your campaign from your PC/Mac while sending an additional Player's View to a secondary display. For even more immersion mount or project the Player's View display onto your gaming table and use physical miniatures and set pieces to enhance your gaming experience.
In addition to creating and playing content from your Windows or MacOS computers, campaign files are also compatible across the iOS and Android versions of the app.
This allows GM/DMs to use tools like:

Digital Maps (Import existing maps or create them from scratch within InfinitasDM)
Fog of War
Documents (writing, viewing, and organization)
Player tokens
Map Links that connect directly to documents and other maps, and more




All without forcing everyone to play from individual computers over the internet.

219642.name: Pure Pinball
219642.description:
User Summary
Contains 4 original pinball tables: Trains, Racing, War & Hyper Space.

219643.name: Mystic Warriors
219643.description:
User Summary

A scrolling shooter and beat 'em up made by the same team as Sunset Riders.

219644.name: Inquest (Issue 33 - Jan 1998)
219644.description:
Year End Special Issue
Top 10 Predictions for 1998

219646.name: Inquest (Issue 35 - Mar 1998)
219646.description:
Stronghold - Magic Exclusive! The new Set!
Total Chaos - White Wolf's Worlds Collide!

219647.name: Battleaxes & Beasties
219647.description:
From the Publisher:

Built around Old School White Box roleplaying Games, Battleaxes & Beasties is a complete game in one book. It includes all the information you need to create your Adventurers and run a game, including a starting setting, monsters, magic items, and a first level dungeon crawl style adventure.

219649.name: Blackmarsh
219649.description:
Publisher Description:

Blackmarsh is a complete and ready to run sandbox adventure environment designed by Robert S. Conley. It includes all you need to start your adventures, or a adds a whole new region to your own other world.

The Heroes & Other Worlds edition of Blackmarsh was adapted by C.R. Brandon and contains a complete sandbox environment, two mini adventures, and over 15 new creatures for use with Heroes & Other worlds!

This edition is for use with and requires Heroes & Other Worlds adventure game.

219650.name: Arydia: The Paths We Dare Tread
219650.description:
Description from tje publisher:

Arydia is an open world, campaign based, cooperative fantasy role playing game in a box (for 2-4 players). The game of Arydia is built on four design pillars: Exploration, Progression, Combat, and Roleplaying.

Exploration
Arydia is an open world to explore as you wish. You will make your way across the world map, discovering new locations, interacting with memorable characters, fighting vicious monsters, and scavenging long-lost treasures. The world will pull you in through detailed descriptions and vivid artwork for each place you visit. Every location is unique (not a set of reusable tiles) and is built piece by piece as you explore.

Progression
Arydia is meant to be played as a campaign, over the course of a number of game sessions. Everything you do in one game session, carries over to the next. As you play, the game keeps track of your actions and decisions. Your characters will grow in power, collecting new items, weapons, and skills. NPCs and locations will change, depending on how you interact with them. All of this progression is done using a simple, but powerful, index system.

Combat
Many of the locations you’ll visit in Arydia are hostile - and you’ll need your weapons, skills, and cooperation to defeat the challenges you encounter! Arydia features a tactical, co-operative combat system. Enemies are controlled by game cards and dice, while you and your companions work together to overcome them.

Roleplaying
You will take on the roles of a wide cast of characters as you encounter them throughout your journeys. You will step into the shoes of a disgruntled shop owner, sniffling brat, or a poorly-dressed bandit leader. The incentive-based role play system encourages you to engage in dramatic storytelling, without being intrusive.

All of this, and more await in Arydia: The Paths We Dare Tread!

219651.name: Pathways (Issue 62 - Jan 2017)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Bulky Treasures Difficult to Get out of the Dungeon
20 Things Left in an Inn’s Bedchamber

219652.name: Fate Solo
219652.description:
From the introduction:

Fate Solo is a Solo Engine so when playing Fate you don’t have to break out of the system to use a Solo Engine.

There are three main area of rules of Fate Solo:


1. Fate Solo Oracle
2. Character Rules
3. Surprise Factor

219653.description:
A small expansion that consists of 5 Expansion Cards.

These five red/orange cards have the "Alternate Attack" ability, and feature the letters M and Z, and intended to replace the "Attack" cards in the original game.

These cards allow players to activate an ability to hurt other players, for example by forcing them to discard cards.
219653.name: Dexikon: Alternate Letters Expansion

219654.name: Miburo-Tenmatsuki
219654.description:
A main issue game of War Game Japanese History #27.

The Miburoushi-gumi was a former organization of the famous Shinsen-gumi.

The game uses a worker-placement system and abstractly covers the period from the start of the Miburoushi-gumi to the end of the Boshin War.

In start, only mild preparing missions can be conducted such as recruiting, financing, connection making. Then, each turn a new mission is revealed and can be selected. The most VPs are awarded for assassination of enemy roushi and/or success of military campaign.

The game ends after 5 or 6 turns and can be played with 2,3 or 4 players and finished in 2 hours.

219655.name: Chinese Zodiac Card Game
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
219655.description:
This is a traditional card game from the southern parts of Taiwan and Penghu County. The game uses 10 sets of 12 cards depicting the 12 Chinese zodiacs, namely the Rat, Ox, Tiger, Rabbit, Dragon, Snake, Horse, Goat, Monkey, Rooster, Dog and Pig.

Players are dealt 11 cards each, with the banker dealt an extra card. The goal of the game is to form sets of 3, either in sequence or of the same zodiac. It is also possible to form a set of 12, i.e. all 12 zodiacs. The player who manages to go out first, i.e. 胡牌, receives a certain amount of chips from the other players.

219656.name: The Dark Eye - Spells & Rituals
219656.description:
This card pack contains all magic cantrips, spells and rituals introduced with TDE Core Rules. It also includes magical special abilities, protective and warding circles, staff enchantments, witch curses, familiar's tricks and elven magical songs as well as useful summaries and charts for spell and ritual modifications.

Contains 118 Cards

Wizard characters in The Dark Eye learn different magical spells and rituals. These game reference cards present a handy, colorful reference for each possible spell and ritual that they can refer to easily and consistently during play! No need to flip through the Core Rules to find the specific data … it’s right on the Spells & Rituals card!

219657.name: The Dark Eye - Advantages & Disadvantages
219657.description:
This card pack contains all advantages and disadvantages from the TDE Core Rules as well as at-a-glance summaries for improving skills and abilities. Using these cards, players and game masters alike can easily check the costs and effects of advantages and disadvantages.

Contains 104 Cards

Players customize their characters in The Dark Eye by assigning persistent Advantages and Disadvantages that affect their game play and interaction with the fantasy world Aventuria.

These game reference cards present a handy, colorful reference for each possible Advantage or Disadvantage they can refer to easily and consistently during play! No need to flip through the Core Rules to find the specific data … it’s right on the Advantages & Disadvantages card!

219658.name: The Dark Eye - Combat & Special Abilities
rpgitemversion: TDE Card Pack - Combat & Special Abilities
219658.description:
This card pack contains all combat and general special abilities from the TDE Core Rules. It also offers a useful overview of botches and combat situations and includes cards for states and conditions.

Contains 104 Cards

Characters in The Dark Eye specialize in fighting styles and maneuvers. These game reference cards present a handy, colorful reference for each possible Combat and Feat specialization that they can refer to easily and consistently during play! No need to flip through the Core Rules to find the specific data … it’s right on the Combat & Feats card!

219659.name: The Dark Eye - Liturgies & Ceremonies
219659.description:
This card pack contains all blessings, liturgical chants and ceremonies from the TDE Core Rules. It also includes all karma special abilities as well as useful charts and overviews for chanting liturgies.

Contains 65 Cards

Blessed One characters in The Dark Eye learn different liturgical chants and ceremonies to invoke the powers of their gods. These game reference cards present a handy, colorful reference for each possible liturgical chant and ceremony that they can refer to easily and consistently during play! No need to flip through the Core Rules to find the specific data … it’s right on the Liturgies & Ceremonies card!

219661.name: Crop Rotation
219661.description:
In English, the term "Crop Rotation" means Rotation of Cultures, which is nothing more than alternating planting of different crops to benefit the soil. In Crop Rotation, you'll grow beans, corn, and soybeans, and to win, you'll need to harvest more than your opponents.

For this you need to complete the random patterns of the goal cards and score. You have to be smart and not let your opponents harvest before you. Each turn random events can also help you, allowing you to switch position crops or even perform a burn to free up space on the board.

219662.description:
Station One is the second Data Pack in the Red Sand Cycle for Android: Netrunner, and it continues the cycle's exploration of the tensions between the Corps, Runners, and clan members of Mars.

With its sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards), Station One carries us to the primary hub for Bradbury Railway Co.’s mag-lev inductracks, a site that's crucial to the distribution of food, fuel, and raw materials across the resource-starved cities and nodes of Mars. The Martian colonists scattered across the planet’s surface rely upon its supplies for their survival. The megacorps terraforming the planet—and increasing their control over it—view the station as a vital hub for their financial investments. And the opportunistic runners of Android: Netrunner? They see Station One as a tempting target through which all the secrets of Mars must pass.

You'll find new assets, resources, programs, and barriers. You'll find Clan Aeneas exerting its influence. And you'll find a daring new Criminal runner identity—one willing to "face check" ice if it will help him turn a profit.
219662.name: Android: Netrunner – Station One

219664.name: Willow (Arcade)
219664.description:
User Summary

A scrolling platform game with fighting and shooting elements based on the 1988 film.

219665.name: BEEctionary
219665.description:
BEEctionary is a hex tile placement word game. The game allows players to play in 12 various languages - English, German, French, Russian, Turkish, Arabic, Persian, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Dutch and Azerbaijani (all letter tiles are included in one box).

The goal is to create in each round the longest word no one can beat by placing only one letter tile each turn. The game starts with bee hex that could be used as any letter during active player's turn. The word can be in any direction as long as all hex tiles to be used are adjacent and in proper sequence. After each round winner of the round takes all hexes he/she used on his longest word. Next round starts with the next player and with all tiles left on the table after winner of previous round gets his tiles.

Player scores 1 point for each letter and 3 points for bee hex. The one who reaches 20 points first is the winner of the game.

219666.name: Ciudad de Cartón
219666.description:
In "Ciudad de Cartón", players take on the role of investors who direct the construction of a batch group.
Each turn, they roll dice to see what resources they have available, buy buildings, build in their city as well as survive different disasters.
Get the highest quality of life and build the best city!

219667.name: Gunship Crew: A Solitaire Game of Helicopter Gunship Combat in Viet Nam (1965-1973).
219667.description:
Gunship Crew is a Game where you are a Commander of a Helicopter Gunship in a Helicopter Assault Company in Viet Nam. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and crew and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). If the Player takes too many losses before their Campaign is complete, the Enemy will gain the initiative and win.

Missions include rescuing downed crews, helicopter assaults, convoy escorts, river patrols, hunter-killer and general fire support.

The Combat system is similar to the one used in Patton's Best by Avalon Hill. This method best captures the feeling of flying a single Helicopter and resolving combat.

GUNSHIP CREW can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

219668.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Skaven & Dwarf Pitch
219668.description:
Play games of Blood Bowl on this excellent double-sided foldout card pitch! Made to the same specifications as the pitch found in the boxed game, it features a filthy, ‘orrible Skaven pitch on one side – the reeking, dank cavern is perfect for scuttling about on – and a much tidier, properly-hewn Dwarven stadium-vault on the other. Of course, the 2 double-sided dugouts follow the same themes.

Supplied with a new Subterranean Weather Table – exclusive rules featuring weather effects appropriate to underground sports brutality!

219669.description:
Nine bonus cards included with the fulfilment of the 2016 Kickstarter campaign.

- AK-47 (Revolutionary Card)
- Growing Social Discontent (Starting Event)
- Last Stand (Revolutionary Card)
- Remembering Poznań (Starting Event)
- SPA Members Suspected (Starting Event)
- Blue, Yellow, Red, Green Characters
219669.name: Days of Ire: Budapest 1956: Kickstarter Promo Cards

219670.name: HUNGER: The Show
219670.description:
Casting call for the reality show HUNGER!

Are you ready for the adventure of a lifetime? Do you have the wits to survive, with other participants, on a deserted tropical island? Or simply want to win $1,000,000? If so, HUNGER is searching for self-reliant contestants to attempt this bold adventure.

HUNGER is a fast paced family game with rich player interaction. To win, you have to predict your opponent’s actions. On the island, you can gather fruit and catch chickens to get more food. But to win, you also have to collect raft pieces. It's a good thing that no one would ever think of stealing food and raft parts from other participants...

HUNGER is a family/filler game for 2-6 players, ages 7 and above, lasting 20 minutes.

Story: Welcome to HUNGER Reality Show! There is a 1 Million Dollar Prize and there can only be one winner. Alongside other participants, unfortunately not your best friends, you are cast onto a desert island. There is some food provided by the TV crew but it will not last long. You will be hungry very soon and will have to start picking fruit or catching chickens. You will also need to build a raft if you are serious about winning the prize. The first person to leave the island will be declared as winner. You will need rope and raft wood, which are hard to find. Well, you could always try to steal from the others, but would you?

Mechanic: Players simultaneously choose their next action and destination on the island. To be successful, players need to predict the other players' actions but also stay focused on their goal: having enough food to survive the next day (or otherwise being evacuated by the film crew according to the principle ‘your safety is our highest priority’) and building the raft as quickly as possible. Balancing those needs is key to winning the game. This is what makes the game so broadly appreciated among gamers but also non-gamers, families and children. The game is fast, smooth and easy to play and has no downtime, while allowing for a lot of player interactions. The better player will on average usually win most games but it is possible for a 7-year-old to win on occasion too, which makes the game a fun experience for everyone.

219671.name: Prison of Eternal Torture
219671.description:
From the introduction:

South of the city of Leoben lays the small island of Krisaga. A swamp filled land, home to the hidden prison of eternal torture. Every hundred years, for one week, the prison's entrance is opened for Leoben to deposit the city's vile and guilty.

User summary:

For 5th level characters.

219672.name: Free Maze
219672.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Neo Productions Unlimited is thrilled to launch the new Quick Crawls Maps line! In the vein of NPU's Quick Crawls Adventures, Quick Crawls Maps offers gamers a fast, simple, way to game! Each Quick Crawls Maps product features an original dungeon layout and several prints to offer players, game masters, and even publishers more options! With several maps, many tunnels and passages, and a creative team of foes, a single Quick Crawls Map can easily provide a full evening of adventure, exploration, and more!
In each Quick Crawls Maps product, you will find:

A fully textured map for viewing pleasure!
An aged map, perfect for handouts for players!
A black & white gird-only printout for easy use and light ink usage!
All maps print to one page for convenient printing, use, and storage!
Publishers! All Quick Crawls Maps products are also licensed for small-press usage! Include a quick dungeon with sample adventures, chain several together to produce a sprawling dungeon! Just add the note â€œSome map illustrations copyright Neo Productions Unlimited, 2008-2009, used with permission", and you're good to go!

Watch OneBookShelf sites for more information, including additional maps, map packs, adventures, and more!

An aged map, perfect for handouts for players!
A black & white gird-only printout for easy use and light ink usage!
All maps print to one page for convenient printing, use, and storage!
Publishers! All Quick Crawls Maps products are also licensed for small-press usage! Include a quick dungeon with sample adventures, chain several together to produce a sprawling dungeon! Just add the note â€œSome map illustrations copyright Neo Productions Unlimited, 2008-2009, used with permission", and you're good to go!

Watch OneBookShelf sites for more information, including additional maps, map packs, adventures, and more!

219684.name: Dungeon Collection #1
219684.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Neo Productions Unlimited is thrilled to launch the new Quick Crawls Maps line! In the vein of NPU's Quick Crawls Adventures, Quick Crawls Maps offers gamers a fast, simple, way to game!
Quick Crawls Maps - Dungeon Collection #1 is a brand new package from the Quick Crawls line, offering a set of six unique dungeon floor plans for a variety of uses! This package is especially made with the creative DM or publisher in need of generic maps in mind; each map represents a simple stonework floor carved from granite, allowing the maps to be dropped into nearly any fantasy campaign imaginable!
With several maps, many tunnels and passages, and a creative team of foes, a single Quick Crawls Map can easily provide a full evening of adventure, exploration, and more!
For each floor plan included, you will find:

A fully textured map for viewing pleasure!
A black & white gird-only printout for easy use and light ink usage!
All maps print to one page for convenient printing, use, and storage!
Publishers! All Quick Crawls Maps products are also licensed for small-press usage! Include a quick dungeon with sample adventures, chain several together to produce a sprawling dungeon! Just add the note â€œSome map illustrations copyright Neo Productions Unlimited, 2008-2009, used with permission", and you're good to go!

Watch OneBookShelf sites for more information, including additional maps, map packs, adventures, and more!

219685.name: Dungeon Collection #2, Ice Caverns
219685.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Neo Productions Unlimited is thrilled to launch the new Quick Crawls Maps line! In the vein of NPU's Quick Crawls Adventures, Quick Crawls Maps offers gamers a fast, simple, way to game!
Quick Crawls Maps - Dungeon Collection #2 is a brand new package from the Quick Crawls line, offering a set of six unique dungeon floor plans for a variety of uses! This package is especially made with the creative DM or publisher in need of generic maps in mind; each map represents a simple iced cavern floor, allowing the maps to be dropped into nearly any fantasy campaign imaginable!
With several maps, many tunnels and passages, and a creative team of foes, a single Quick Crawls Map can easily provide a full evening of adventure, exploration, and more!
For each floor plan included, you will find:

A fully textured map for viewing pleasure!
A black & white gird-only printout for easy use and light ink usage!
All maps print to one page for convenient printing, use, and storage!
Publishers! All Quick Crawls Maps products are also licensed for small-press usage! Include a quick dungeon with sample adventures, chain several together to produce a sprawling dungeon! Just add the note â€œSome map illustrations copyright Neo Productions Unlimited, 2008-2009, used with permission", and you're good to go!

Watch OneBookShelf sites for more information, including additional maps, map packs, adventures, and more!

219686.name: Dungeon Collection #3, Heart of a Volcano
219686.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Neo Productions Unlimited is thrilled to launch the new Quick Crawls Maps line! In the vein of NPU's Quick Crawls Adventures, Quick Crawls Maps offers gamers a fast, simple, way to game!
Quick Crawls Maps - Dungeon Collection #3 is a brand new package from the Quick Crawls line, offering a set of six unique dungeon floor plans for a variety of uses! This package is especially made with the creative DM or publisher in need of generic maps in mind; each map represents a chaotic level from the heart of a volcano or hellish landscape, allowing the maps to be dropped into nearly any fantasy campaign imaginable!
With several maps, many tunnels and passages, and a creative team of foes, a single Quick Crawls Map can easily provide a full evening of adventure, exploration, and more!
For each floor plan included, you will find:

A fully textured map for viewing pleasure!
A black & white gird-only printout for easy use and light ink usage!
All maps print to one page for convenient printing, use, and storage!
Publishers! All Quick Crawls Maps products are also licensed for small-press usage! Include a quick dungeon with sample adventures, chain several together to produce a sprawling dungeon! Just add the note â€œSome map illustrations copyright Neo Productions Unlimited, 2008-2009, used with permission", and you're good to go!

Watch OneBookShelf sites for more information, including additional maps, map packs, adventures, and more!

219687.name: Envision-a-Villain
219687.description:
From publisher blurb:

Co-written by Ross Payton (of Base Raiders fame), AP Klosky (Cold Steel Wardens) and Bry Hitchcock, Envision a Villain is here to help the time-strapped Fate GM. It' provides handy advice and guidance for creating supervillains in Fate. It includes several sample characters ready to face down the heroes (or gritty anti-heroes) at your gaming table.

Superheroic role-playing games live and die on the quality of the villains facing the players. No matter how cool the superheroes are, the players will lose interest if they do not face sufficiently challenging and interesting foes. Creating a great super villain is one of the key skills of any GM who wants to run a superhero game.

219688.name: Level 3: The Clairvoyant Halls
219688.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third level of the Halls of the Eternal Moment are the domain of Illquis of the Thousand Eyes. Illquis is a derro necromancer, and was once a figure of great power and an ally of the wizard that laid claim to the Black Star. She has been trapped deep within the Halls for the last age, finally freed as the unleashed power of the Star that froze time in this place slowly began to unravel. Illquis is only a shadow of her former self, quite literally. The strange temporal warping of the Halls has displaced her in both mind body.

Infinite Dungeon: The Halls of the Eternal Moment Level Three - The Clairvoyant Hall is a great add-on for the Infinite Dungeon mega dungeon. This level is perfect for 3rd level adventures and promises action and excitement.

219689.name: Jin Lung
219689.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kaiju!

Summoned by the Grand Emperor to serve as the guardian of his Hong Kong palace, Jin Lung (PL 13) is a loyal servant and protector. To the people of Hong Kong, Jin Lung is both a blessing and a curse. He is Protector against the aggressions of Communist China, but he is also an inhuman monster.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

219690.name: False Priest
219690.description:
From publisher blurb:

False priests have a knack for disguising their arcane or psychic magic as god-given divine magic, and in the use of divine scrolls, staves, and wands. They roam the lands as false prophets, using their power to convince the unfaithful of their misplaced loyalties in other gods and governments and to defeat those who oppose them.

219691.name: Mage of the Third Eye
219691.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mages of the third eye have focused their studies on the mystical power of the third eye to increase their divination abilities, and through this study have discovered abilities that no other mystic can claim to possess.

219692.name: A Hero's Death
219692.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Hero’s Death is an expansion to any fantasy roleplaying game, allowing gamemasters and PCs to track their characters’s heroism and write appropriate finales. This system works for any fantasy game, including modern rules systems and OSR games.

The system uses points to track a character's relevance to the game world. Upon their death, the character gets a ceremony befitting their heroism. It is as straight-forward as it sounds. Simple and clean, it works for all fantasy game systems from 1st ed to new OSR to 4th and beyond.

219693.name: The Jelly Father
219693.description:
From publisher blurb:

The evildoer spotlight is a new Saturday Morning Tabletop RPG series of short books (5-10 pages), introducing knew enemies, animals and other antagonists. Included in every book will be a brief summary of the evildoer, their character traits and possible plot hooks to tie that evildoer into an adventure, and of course their stats.

Bonus material will also be included in each evildoer spotlight. The nature of the bonus material may be a new magic item, a supporting cast of weaker evildoers or even a new evildoer trait to add to the list of traits found in the evildoer toolkit at the end of the core rule book.

Book #2: The Jelly Father

The Jelly father is a tortured man that followed a tortured path. He, or “it”, is a massive gelatinous mass of digestive goo, giant magical eyes & ill intent.

Included in the spotlight is Yuseff Belkir (the jelly father) and his gelatinous spawn. As well as the Gelatinous trait for your evildoer toolkit & two examples of gelatinous evildoers made with the new trait.

The Jelly Father & his minions are suitable antagonists for level 1-14 characters. As Yuseff is a powerful Adversary and even his minions have minions. And with the new gelatinous trait, you can create &/or modify any evildoer to suite the level range and challenge you wish.

219695.name: White Noise
219695.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's 1967, you're roaming the snow filled fields of Alaska, your pulse stays at a steady 115 bpm. It's cold enough to kill a moose, but you don't have time for that. Terror has set into the crew as you've seen more than you bargained for. 'Screw the mission... This is about making it home alive' is the only thing going through your mind. Be prepared to face the unknown...

This short horror adventure includes:

setting rules
a table with mutations to use (or buy the Mutation Deck for even more crazy mutations)
twists and complications to use
5 pre-generated characters and character sheets
figure flats
different handouts to use in the game
table tents

219696.description:
Shell Beach is a treasure trove to the Hermit Crabs that live there, and the bravest crabs scramble between waves to collect the most desirable seashells to bring to the Market. Some shells are even big enough to make a home out of! Each player is a daring hermit crab scrapping seashells for sale, trying to upgrade their own shell, keeping one eye on the competition, and even taking each other’s old shells. Make the most of each tide, before the Market closes for the season!

Shell Beach is played over a series of Rounds, which have a Collection Phase, where cards are dealt and drafted, and a Market Phase, where sets are sold and special shells can be used.

Sets of shell cards can be turned into the Market for tokens, but the biggest ones can be lived in by the Crabs, which will allow them to carry more and better sets back to market. There are also 4 Magic Seashells that hypnotize a crab into abandoning their home shell, initiating a unique new game mechanic based on real-life crab behavior.

When the market runs out of tokens, each player remaining finishes the current round and the winner is revealed.
219696.name: Shell Beach

219697.name: Hyper Sports
219697.description:
User Summary
The sequel to Track n Field. This time the events are:

Swimming
Skeet Shooting
Long Horse
Archery
Triple Jump
Weight Lifting
Pole Vault

219698.name: Last Chip Standing: Devil's Luck
219698.description: Last Chip Standing: Devil's Luck is a fiendishly simple, feather-light game of chance for 3+ players. In this Wild Western game of chance, roll dice, pass and steal loot, and be the last outlaw with chips to win the whole pot.

219699.name: The Witch: Aiséiligh Tradition
219699.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rise up witches!

The world is in peril. The forces of evil in the guise of law and weal threaten all lands.

The people of good conscious scream out for champions.

The Witches of the Aiséiligh Tradition hear those cries and are charged by the Goddess to be Her hands and Her mortal representatives on this plane.

And the Goddess is angry.

The Witch: Aiséiligh Tradition presents a new witch tradition for use in Swords & Wizardry Complete. Inside you will find:

The Aiséiligh witch Tradition
The Daughters of the Flame Coven
70+, new to Swords & Wizardry spells including never before published spells.

219700.name: Plague Rat
219700.description:
From publisher blurb:

A rare and horrible disease exists in the distant corners of the world: Turb Mortu. Infecting its victim’s brains, it enslaves them to an insidious and aggressive hive mind. Forever seeking to expand its influence, the disease sends its slaves out into the world to spread their sickness.

Born from the rodent strain of the Turb Mortu disease, the Plague Rat is one such victim. While the humble qualities of the rat might make it seem like one of the weaker agents of the disease, the Plague Rat’s ability to quickly infect large numbers make it a potent and hard to quash foe. One Plague Rat isn’t intimidating. A thousand gnawing at your door, though? Even the bravest warriors might tremble at the spectacle.

219701.name: King and Cafe
219701.description:
User summary:

王さまとカフェ (King and Cafe) is a game of speed, where players are vying to fill the most cafe orders for the king.

At the start of the game, one player is chosen as king, while all others take the role of local cafe managers. Each player draws a hand of seven cards. There is a pile of order cards for the king and ingredients for the managers. The king briefly displays all of their order cards and then the managers are allowed to adjust their hand of ingredients.

At the beginning of each round, the king chooses an order card and plays it face up to the table. All of the cafe managers then race to gather the ingredients from their hand and touch the standee of the king. The first player to successfully complete the order, receives the order card and its points.

Managers are then allowed to discard and draw until they have a hand of seven cards in preparation for the next round. After seven rounds have passed, the cafe managers tally up the value of the order cards they completed. The player with the highest total wins.

219702.description:
Beneath is a dungeon crawling board game with a slight difference for 2 to 4 players. Each player pits their will against each other, Mining, trapping, stealing and fighting. Players take their heroic dwarfs through a series of ancient mines, buying new powerful weapons and skills. Take your dwarf on a quest to find your claim to the stone throne before your fellow Dwarves. On their way they'll face many challenges and traps. You may even befriend the local merchant with the game's brilliant purchasing system.

OBJECT OF THE GAME:
To mine the caverns below and find an ancient vain of untold riches. Only then may you stake your claim to the Stone Throne. You do this by mining and fighting your fellow Dwarves, buying new items and weapons in order to mine faster and find missing clues as to the location of the fathers gift.

GAME PLAY:
- Each player chooses a Dwarf to play as, Each dwarf has their own special skill set and abilities.
-Once chosen each player get a chance to purchase items from the local merchant.
- A map is then chosen and all players enter that map. The map can consist of Rocks, Unbreakable slate, Fires and many other things.
- Players take turn in mining the rock, mining is determined by what weapons you have and thus selecting the correct dice.
- Players mine till one of the players finds an exit or all players are knocked out of the map. This may be done by fighting or trapping each other while mining players find gold and can buy items at the end of each map.
- Players can get ahead in the game by teaming up on other players or trying to quickly exit maps that don't play to their advantage or by saving up gold for specific items that may be good on harder maps but not very good on early maps.
- In side the mines players will find clues to the secret location of the fathers gift, a long lost vein of gold burred deep beneath the mountain.
- Only once all of the clues are found may a player win the game and claim the stone throne.
STORY:
For untold centuries, Stonewatch has stood as the shining jewel of the dwarven people, a massive underground city located beneath the Godsfell Mountains. And, for an equal measure of time, riches have flowed like water from its gates, courtesy of The Father’s Gift, a legendary vein of ore said to make even the vast riches of the ancient kings seem like mere trinkets in comparison.

Under the rule of the Irongaard clan, there came a time of prosperity, peace, and trade with the neighboring kingdoms. But the opulence of the dwarves also attracted attention of a less savory nature. The greedy eyes of heathen beasts, and bandits were ever vigilant in searching for avenues that would allow them to take, either by force or guile, the riches of the dwarves and claim them for their own.

The dwarves were unbending in their defense, though, and they kept their foes at bay, repelling attack after attack. But their enemies were persistent. Every bauble they stole, no matter how small, served only to further incite their greed.

In time, their patience paid off. The tunnels beneath the Godsfell Mountains were numerous and, even after centuries of diligent exploration by the dwarves, many remained unexplored. Eventually, a way in was found, one that would bypass the nearly impenetrable gates that served as Stonewatch’s vanguard.

Following this discovery, a great conclave was called among the dwarves’ many enemies. After much petty squabbling, they pledged to form a dark alliance aimed at crushing Stonewatch and seizing the Father’s Gift from the great kingdom that had so long vexed them.

So it was that the Great War began during the watch of Gildor Irongaard, seventh king of his line.


* *


Now, the war is finally over. With the swing of an axe, the head of Gorve Bloodclaw, mightiest of the heathen beasts chieftains, was cleaved from his shoulders. Their morale broken, the remnants of his forces scattered, bringing to an end the years of misery and bloodshed.

The victory has been a costly one, though. Stonewatch lies in ruins. Gildor Irongaard is dead, along with his sons. No king sits upon the Stone Throne. Worst of all, the Father’s Gift has been lost, the mines leading to it having been collapsed to prevent their enemies from gaining a toehold.

It is a dark time for the dwarves, but perhaps it need not be.

There are rumors that the many battles of the war opened up new tunnels to the deep, passages previously unknown. Perhaps one of these will lead back to the Gift, allowing its riches to once more inspire the dwarven people with the drive they need to rebuild their once great civilization.

Whoever can find it will be hailed a hero and savior. The Stone Throne will be theirs for the taking.

Will you undertake this quest? Are you brave enough to explore the dark confines of collapsed tunnels, abandoned mines, and whatever may be waiting inside of them? Are you clever enough to outsmart those who are likewise searching for the Father’s Gift?

Only time will tell if you have what it takes to survive what lies beneath.
219702.name: Beneath

219704.name: Pocket Pharmacy
219704.description:
A dice game where you brew potions out of 5 different ingredients. The lead player takes cubes out of a bag, forms as many groups as there are players, and then each player picks one of the groups. Players then use these cubes to make potions, empower potions and sell them.

The player who most skillfully brews potions, and gains the most money in the end is the winner!

219706.name: Emoji Battle with KO Expansion
219706.description:
Make those cute little emojis fight for you.
The angel, happy, gritted teeth, sad, mad, devil and more; all your favorite emojis come out to play in this unique game where you set fellow players up to hurt themselves. It is a race to get rid of all your cards first as everyone is trying to make you fail. Unique game play lends itself to an all out battle, where any emoji might be your last.

The Knockout (KO) Expansion
Beyond the cute faces you are used to seeing, there are other emoji symbols that can help you in battle. Throw the time bomb on the table, or place a target on your greatest enemy, then dawn a shield to protect yourself. This expansion adds a collection of extra cards to make your emoji battles even better. Will you be the one to deliver the knockout punch and get rid of your cards first? Only time will tell.

Game Play
Players take turns playing emojis from their hand. Every card played has consequences based on the last card played before it. First person out of cards wins the round. After five rounds game is over. Scoring based on emojis left in your hand after every round.

219707.name: Wayfinder (Issue 16 - Winter 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Close and Personal: New Technological Melee Weapons
Side Trek: Pursue the Iron Princess
Weal or Woe: Ghost Wolves, Traitorous and True
Weal or Woe: Pursue the Iron Princess
219707.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Created for Pathfinder fans by Pathfinder fans, this sixteenth issue of the ENnie Award-winning Wayfinder fanzine is a technological wonder, exploring all the sci-fi weirdness that is Numeria! This free fanzine includes dozens of articles, including original fiction, new monsters, adventures, classes and options, magic and technological items, and even a new game—this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

Contributing Authors: Gabriel Almer, Kate Baker, Matt Banach, Jason Owen Black, Dave Breitmaier, Jeremy Clements, Jeremy Corff, Chuck DiTusa, Matt Duval, Natalie Ellis, Robert Feather, Jon Forrester, Spencer Giffin, Wojciech Gruchala, Violet Hargrave, Jeffrey Hersh, Eric Hindley, Nicholas Hite, Andrew Hoskins, Brian 'Ehn' Jolly, Cailean Keith, John Laffan, Thomas LeBlanc, Isabelle Lee, Jeff Lee, Zack Litchfield, Ben Martin, Jacob W. Michaels, Matt Morris, Matt Roth, Elliot Smith, Kendra Leigh Speedling, Jeff Taft, Ian Turner, Brendan Ward, and Kelly Youngblood.

Contributing Artists: Becky Barnes, Catherine Batka, John Bunger, Paul Chapman, Tyler Clark, Snow Conrad, Jeremy Corff, Liz Courts, Andrew DeFelice, Jess Door, Peter Fairfax, Sergej Felsinger, Lynnette Fetters, Erin Frye, Silvia Gonzalez, Bob Greyvenstein, Stephen Harvey, Frank Hessefort, Fil Kearney, Jason Kirckof, Clay Lewis, Mike Lowe, Dave Mallon, Stephen McAndrews, Dionisis Milonas, Katey Neve, Beatrice Pelagatti, Pfenix Artwork, Tanagorn Prateepsukjit, Basil Arnould Price, Tanyaporn Sangsnit, Kristiina Seppä, Ashton Sperry, Carlos Torreblanca, and Stephen Wood

Cartography by Liz Courts, Alex J. Moore
Cover Art and Design by Chris L. Kimball
Foreword by Crystal Frasier

219708.name: Professor Evil and The Citadel of Time
219708.description:
Professor Evil owns a time machine, and he's been ripping off all the best historical items from times both past and future. Your team has been charged with confiscating these items and returning them to their proper locations in time, so you now need to infiltrate the mansion and abscond with four items before Prof. Evil can secret four of them in locations inaccessible to you. Thankfully the old soul is a bit daft and won't evaporate you should he catch you lurking through the mansion, but simply scoot you out the front door where he'll forget about you immediately.

On a turn, you first draw and reveal two cards from your tiny deck, then keep one of the cards based on what you think will help you this turn. You then take three actions, such as open a door in the room you're in, move from a room (or outside) to another room (assuming the door is open), disable a trap, or grab a treasure; using a card isn't an action unless it says otherwise. You can repeat actions as desired or needed, but you can't enter a room with Prof. Evil and you can't exit the house on your own (in order to run across the grounds to another window) once you enter. You're now committed to grabbing those treasures!

After you finish your turn, Prof. Evil now moves, but again he's not all there, so he doesn't necessarily move in a logical manner. To move him, you roll three dice: One die advances the secondary Prof. Evil figure on the clock on the board either five or ten minutes; the other two determine where Prof. Evil moves and how far. What's more, as he walks through rooms, he closes the doors through which he travels and reactivates any inactive traps he encounters. If you roll a blue and a 1, for example, he moves through the blue doorway into the next adjacent room; a red and a 3 will move him through three rooms, walking through the red doorway each time. A color and a particular signal will teleport him immediately to the treasure bearing the same colored marker.

Let's look at these treasures in more detail: Each treasure shows a time value and one or more traps on it. Three treasures are placed on the board, then a blue, red and green token are placed on the treasures, with a matching blue, red and green token placed on the game board clock on the time matching what's on the treasure. The Magna Carta might say 45 minutes, for example, and after placing a blue token on the Magna Carta, you place a blue token on the clock 45 minutes away from where the Prof. Evil figure is located. If Prof. Evil moves onto this token on the clock, then that treasure is lost — and if you lose four treasures, then you've lost the game. Remove it from play and replace it with a new treasure, marking the proper time on the clock.

Note that you can't just grab a treasure, however. Professor Evil can't be in the same room (of course), but you also must ensure that all the traps shown on the treasure are currently deactivated. The game board starts with eight traps on it — half active, half not — and you'll play tug-of-war with Professor Evil over keeping them in this status. Collect a treasure, and a new one will be added to the game board; collect four treasures before Prof. Evil does, and you all win Professor Evil and The Citadel of Time.

219710.name: Orthanc: The Dark Seed Quest
219710.description:
User summary:

This scenario describes the entry level and two of the dungeon levels of Saruman's tower of Orthanc, based on an alternate history of Tolkien's Middle-earth. In the scenario, Orthanc has been abandoned and largely is in ruins.

The scenario is an unpublished manuscript - Tracy and Laura Hickman papers for Orthanc role-playing game; MSS 8180; Tracy and Laura Hickman papers; L. Tom Perry Special Collections; Literary Manuscripts; 1130 Harold B. Lee Library; Brigham Young University; Provo, Utah 84602.

The scenario has a manila card cover with (apparently) professionally printed graphics. The text is typewritten, single-sided pages, with numbering. Several maps are included, many of them laminated. Not all maps are labeled, however. The scenario is three-hole punched. The scenario includes about twenty pages of maps and notes from an unrelated science-fiction scenario.

The scenario is divided into three "chapters". Each chapter begins with a 2-3 page fictional introduction and then proceeds to a keyed room-by-room description of a single level of the tower.

Chapter 1 describes "The Hall of the March of Kings", which is the main entrance level of the tower. Based on illustrations included in the manuscript, this entrance level is well above ground level, accessed through a long and steep set of stairs. The original function of the level was the "reception of guests". The level consists of seventeen keyed areas, and opponents include bandits, a gelatinous cube, and an evil cleric. It is unclear whether levels above the entrance level were contemplated.

Chapter 2 describes "Oracles & The Tower Guard", which is the level beneath the entrance level. The original function of the level was the "housing and care of tower guards" and also for "mining rich ore" and "slave quarters". The ore referred to appears to have been external to the tower. The level consists of thirty keyed areas, and opponents include a gelatinous cube, zombies, orcs, a sixth-level magic user, and a trapper.

Chapter 3 describes "Lockholes", which is the next level down. The original function of the level was "prisoner security" and the provision of "support areas" for the guard. The level appears as a maze of corridors with numerous small rooms ("lockholes") used as prison cells. The level consists of thirty-five keyed areas (many containing multiple cells), and opponents include giant centipedes, orcs, and two seventh-level evil clerics. This level is unique in providing a partially complete table of random encounters ("wandering monsters").

Numerous maps are included in the scenario:


Unlabeled partial lower level
Laminated unlabeled level (probably level 1)
Two illustrations that appear to be simple maps
Laminated "Level G", subtitled "Seeds of Saruman Quest"
Three minor variants of a map labeled "Level III Orthank" (note "k"); two are laminated, one appears to be a play-generated map
Two unlabeled maps - based on the keyed areas and the rooms these almost certainly are the third level "lockholes"; one appears to be a design balance tally - they are significantly different from the three "Level III Orthank" maps noted above
Two minor variants of a map labeled "Level 5 Treasure Hold"; one is laminated; one appears to be a design balance tally; they both note the level as 165 rooms
Unlabeled map
Unlabeled map and on reverse several unlabeled map fragments


These two maps appear related to each other but likely are not part of the scenario (though included with it) - they are on different graph paper and have a different visual appearance:


Unlabeled map with fragment of second map
Unlabeled map


Four pages of illustrations of the tower are provided; it has a unique outline - and appears to be in good repair (as illustrated). One illustration appears to show the tower floating in air (may simply be an incomplete rendering).

General comments. The manuscript is available for public access in a controlled reading room environment (photography, copies, etc., are not permitted). The loose pages in the manuscript are stored in a folder and the pages are mingled with approximately 20 pages from an obviously unrelated science-fiction locale. The page count indicated here is a "best estimate" because it's unclear whether all maps belong to the scenario and because many maps have duplicate copies. The design suggests at least a few more deep levels were contemplated. The scenario is more developed than most "homebrew" dungeons, but not as developed as a commercial module. The fusion of proprietary game system with unrelated proprietary setting indicates the scenario probably was not contemplated for commercial release. The scenario appears to date from about 1980.

219711.name: Dungeon Fantasy Collected
219711.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Trove of Dungeon Fantasy Treasure!

For years, the third volume of Pyramid has provided GURPS Dungeon Fantasy players with cutting-edge material for their own crypt-crawling campaigns. This compilation collects Pyramid articles which have appeared outside of the Dungeon Fantasy- and Alternate Dungeons-themed issues, but are of particular interest to Dungeon Fantasy gamers. It includes over 20 articles taken from issues 10, 13, 19, 25, 38, 43, 47, 48, 56, 58, 61, 64, 68, 70, 75, 77, 78, 80, and 82. This is a direct compilation, without updates or changes.

219712.name: Tyranny of Winds, Part 2: Secrets of the Endless Sky
219712.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, Kelizandri, the evil elemental lord of water, conspired with the villainous lords of air, earth, and fire to trap the four good elemental lords within arcane gems. They imprisoned Ranginori, the good elemental lord of air, in a gem that came to be called the Untouchable Opal. Thought lost for eons, the artifact recently found its way into the hands of the Pathfinder Society. With the prisoner of the stone identified, the Society now seeks to free the demigod to win his favor and gain easier access to the Plane of Air.

User summary:

For tier 1 - 5.

219713.name: Tyranny of Winds, Part 3: Caught in the Eclipse
219713.description:
From the introduction:

Untold ages ago, four pairs of powerful demigods — one set tyrannical, one set benevolent — ruled over the four elemental planes. Kelizandri, the evil elemental lord of water, conspired with the villainous lords of air, earth, and fire, to trap the four good elemental lords within arcane gems. One by one, they imprisoned their benevolent counterparts within these artifacts. Ever since, the Garnet Brand, Gasping Pearl, Moaning Diamond, and Untouchable Opal have remained hidden throughout the multiverse, and the residents of the elemental planes now accept the remaining elemental lords’ dominion as part of their existence. Even now, untold millennia later, relatively few know of the existence of the imprisoned demigods.

User summary:

For tier 3 - 7.

219714.name: Koi Musubi
219714.description:
User Summary

In this relationship game, play as Shao-tang who has returned home to work as a receptionist. You work alongside Zih-jin, a friend of yours since childhood. After having a strange prophecy revealed to you, subtle changes start to happen to the relationship between Shao-tang and Zih-jin. Will romance spark, or will you remain single forever?

219715.name: Ambush at Boxcar Rocks
219715.description:
A Gruesome Swansong

From the introduction:

A skirmish where in the players must deal with the stirring, shambling aftermath of a neophyte resurrectionist.

A two hour adventure for 1st - 3rd level characters.

219717.description: 18USA is a member of the 18xx family of railroad games. It requires a copy of 1817 in order to play. It adds additional rules, a larger map, numerous private companies, and additional trains and tiles to create a larger overall game. In addition, it adds randomness to the setup (as was done with 18??) to increase overall replayability of the game. It keeps all of the financial complexity of 1817 on which it is based.
219717.name: 18USA

219718.description:
Description from the publisher:

The NaW Compendium gives you three campaigns, Normandy, Operations Cobra and Arnhem. It's a game of risk and reward as players must learn to conserve their forces. The more lives you spend during one scenario, the fewer they'll have to start the next. However, the more objectives players complete earn them more points which they can use to outfit and re-fit their forces.

You receive from the campaigns a combined 13 scenarios plus an additional 15 stand alone scenarios and another 15 scenarios from our Line of Fire magazine for a total 43 scenarios in total as well as two redesigned maps. NaW Compendium Vol. 1 is the joining of two previous released expansions titled Airborne, Operation Cobra and all the NaW scenarios from Line of Fire magazine. We have cleaned up the scenarios, redesigned and updated the maps and put everything into our new NaW series style.
219718.name: Nations At War: Compendium Vol 1

219719.description:
Omen Quest is a slight trick taking card game based around 5 rounds, where two players or a 4 player co-op on two teams try to out do their opponent with effective card combinations to win each round with the objective to win best out of 3 before the game ties into a death match in the 5th round.

Players maintain 5 cards or 3 cards for 4 players and expense coins to play card combinations. With some luck, and a bit of strategy of how you maneuver through your guild of cards that you burn haven cards to gain better hands, you must avoid burning too many of your haven cards or you instantly lose. Some players take risks, some play conservatively, if you have a good stride with your style it may work for you depending on the player you play against or it may fail you every time.

There are other strategies to win the game that may deplete your opponents coins disabling them from playing effective card combinations to win or playing your hand right forcing your opponent to burn a lot of haven cards. The tone switches drastically from a contemplative 2 player game to a very social 4 player game of banter and psyching as players trade cards and manage wins without doubt of winning the game.
219719.name: Omen Quest

219720.name: GIA Isn't Abstract
219720.description:
Description from the designer:

GIA Isn't Abstract, is a 1-2 player economic dice placement game played over 4 rounds.

The world of GIA (pronounced "Gaia") revolves around 4 fundamental resources - 'A' (pronounced "Eh"), 'B' (pronounced "Be"), 'C' (pronounced "Se"), and 'D' (pronounced "De"). These resources hold fixed values relative to each other and the world's monetary unit - 'VP' (pronounced VePe). You will play traders in GIA's fundamental resource trading market, and will compete to hold the largest share of VPs at the end of trading.

Print and Play files available here:
GIA Isn't Abstract v1.0 Game Rules
GIA Isn't Abstract v1.0 Full Colour Cards
GIA Isn't Abstract v1.0 Low Ink Cards

219721.name: Kakuto Chojin: Back Alley Brutal
219721.description:
Kakuto Chojin is a fighting game generally set in a three-dimensional arena. There are thirteen fighters, each with their own arena. Each character has two styles of fighting; the "Kakuto" style is the only one available at first, with the "Chojin" style acquired after beating Story mode with a character. Kakuto Chojin attempts a different fighting system in that it lacks buttons meant specifically to punch and kick, instead assigning controls to high, middle and low attacks, along with the ability to unleash a special attack. The left trigger allows for free movement around an arena, while the right trigger is used for blocking and an attack modifier. Besides the Story mode, there are the standard Practice and Vs. modes. Kakuto Chojin allows for a Battle Royale with four players at once.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kakuto_Chojin%3A_Back_Alley_Brutal Kakuto Chojin: Back Alley Brutal]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219722.name: The Wild Rings
219722.description:
User Summary
A hybrid fighting game featuring wrestlers, boxers and martial artists. Many of the characters are based on real-life personalities.

219723.description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Yesterday's Enterprise" episode Organized Play event. It is a Federation Galaxy class ship and provides an alternative Enterprise-D to the starter set version.
219723.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Enterprise-D Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

219724.description:
Now supreme leader of the grand Axis army, General Rommel earned his nickname in the sands of North-Africa. He's back there and this time for good: there won't be any retreat this time. Commanding operations in Africa and the Middle-East at the same time, the Desert Fox proves once again that he's one of the best generals on the planet.

This miniatures com with his own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
219724.name: Dust Tactics: General Erwin Rommel – "Desert Fox"

219725.description:
The unarmoured Afrikakorps troops love to have these guys around. A heavy squad is just the thing for tackling stubborn opposition head-on while the other Grenadiers manoeuvre around the flanks. Seeing the destructive heat of their flame-throwers’ gout of burning fuel, it’s little surprise that they are nicknamed ‘Desert Suns’.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
219725.name: Dust Tactics: Wermacht Heavy Flame Grenadier Squad – "Desert Sun"

219726.description:
Major Tina Baumann is the head of the Abwehr for the Neue Deutsches Afrika Korps, the famed NDAK. She is a master counter-spy. When confronting a suspect, she is known to let her vicious pet hyena, Hyäne, do most of the questioning.
Major Baumann’s headquarters are based in Tripoli, Libya. People who enter her compound without wearing an Axis uniform are never to be seen again. Sometimes, even those who wear the uniform disappear for her wrath knows no boundaries.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
219726.name: Dust Tactics: Major Tina Baumann’s – "Tina & Hyane"

219727.name: Bushido: Golden Sentinel
219727.description:
The Golden Sentinels are the bodyguards of the Emperor’s clan, guarding the family on their travels, in their homes and in court. They also serve as escorts to his Teishin as they journey his Empire spreading his holy word. If the Teishin of the Imperial court are the Emperors voice in distant more barbaric lands, then the Golden Sentinels serve as his shield, all proven warriors, sworn to protect their charges with their lives if needed. However, such is the size of the Golden Empire that Imperial missions and postings can often take many seasons to complete not taking into account the travel across the great empire and so often the Sentinels can sometimes take on the local customs and in rare circumstances become embroiled in the affairs of locals.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and three full colour profile cards.

219728.name: Bushido: Yukio Koshimori, Imperial Envoy
219728.description:
Yukio Koshimori is one of the shrewdest, craftiest minds in the empire. Many question his recent arrival in the Jwar Isles, some suggest his appearance a bad omen; that the Empire’s interest in the isles is piqued whilst others claim it can only lead to prosperity. What is certain is that when Yukio speaks, he speaks with the authority of the emperor and whether he is questioning a samurai’s honour, chastising an underling or barking orders, he cannot be dis-obeyed. Yukio is a representative of the Imperial Court and can issue a decree in their name should those in his presence displease him. This single action leaves those who oppose him with their plans in tatters, their troops powerless, having no choice but to obey the word of the Emperor.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base, three full colour profile cards and an enhancement card.

219729.name: Bushido: Bikou
219729.description: The first installment for the Prefecture of Ryu, Bikou is a highly trained ninja. Skilled in the arts of stealth and distraction she strives to strike where her enemies least expect her.

219730.name: Bushido: Mikio
219730.description:
Mikio is a moving mountain on the battlefield. Jumo wrestling skills honed in the pits of Jima enable him to push, pull and throw opponents of the Prefecture at will.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.

219731.name: Bushido: Matsu Takashi
219731.description:
Driven on by a purpose few could match, Matsu fights for her lost sister. The shugenja training she has received for years is now being channelled and focussed in ways her mentors never intended. She balks at no fight against any opponent, seeing any battle as an opportunity to hone her abilities. Allowing her to one day take down her real adversary, Itsunagi Ito.
Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.

219732.name: Bushido: Daisuke
219732.description:
Once washed up, Daisuke now washes away the pain of battle from his allies. He has become a specialist, channelling his Ki to heal and support the forces of the Prefecture. He is never far from the fray and can often be seen ensuring members of the Takashi family return home.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.

219733.name: Bushido: Mizuchi
219733.description:
Mizuchi was recently awoken by the blood of Asama Takashi and he is sworn to protect her twin, Matsu. Swooping into battle he uses tail, tooth and claw as weapons against any who oppose the rule of the Prefecture of Ryu. His ability to quickly and easily traverse the battlefield have already proved the difference in many confrontations. Many within the Prefecture say that Mizuchi is a gift from the Kami’s and a sign of their right to rule.
Blister contains one miniature, one 40mm base and one full colour profile card.

219734.name: Bushido: Tenchi
