An anonymous traitor amidst the Aspis Consortium that the Society has taken to calling Three Rings has helped the Society locate several participants in the conspiracy and hamper their operations.

From the introduction:

For Tier 1 - 5.

219841.name: Hideous Bill and the Gi-Gants
219841.description:
From cassette inlay
Welcome to Hideous Bill and The Gigants. A gripping three part tale of heroism and romance.
Can you help Hideous Bill pit his wits against the Gi-Gants to rescue his true love Greta. This game is based upon an idea from Steve Lee with original music and 'a great deal of help' from Dave Lee.
This is Bill's first starring role in a comupter game. He has appeared before in anonymousminor parts including a reckless frog-squashing lrry driver and the rear end of a giant pantomime camel for which he received an Ernie award nomination as Most Unrecognisable Character.
The Nickname 'Hideous' is was given to him by his ather, 'Happy' Dan Granite out of simple but accurate malice. me met his charming wife Greta at an agricultural machinery exhibition and they now have two reassuringly despicable childring, Justin and Lulu who have appeared on TV as members of Vera Trappist's Timbling Teenies. Bill is also no slouch on the dance floor, combining 'random-leg' style with a total lack of musical awareness.
Bill still works at he local baked bean facotry as a labatory attendant which of cause means a lot of overtime. In his spare time, Bill like to relax by listening to his collection of tape-recorded shipping forcasts or just tinkering with his unique 'friction' bike - the harder he pedals, the slower it goes. He is also a keen windsurfer.
If his career takes off and the money rolls in, he plans to buy himself a pair of carbon-bivr cycle clips and Greta a long holiday in Australia

219842.name: Abducted in Aether
219842.description:
From the introduction:

A faction within the Aspis Consortium calling itself the Korholm Agenda recently launched an attack on the Grand Lodge that left the Society’s Hao Jin Tapestry damaged, as well as Master of Spells Aram Zey dead and his soul imprisoned using nefarious magic. One of the key members of this Aspis strike team was an elf, referred to only by her experiment number in a Conference Z laboratory: 322. As a field-test of her growing abilities, the lead researcher assigned her to the elite strike team and supplied her with a magical lantern that she used to capture Aram Zey’s soul as he died.

From the introduction:

For Tier 7 - 11.

219843.name: Dead Man's Debt
219843.description:
From the introduction:

A faction within the Aspis Consortium calling itself the Korholm Agenda recently launched an attack on the Grand Lodge that left the Society’s Hao Jin Tapestry damaged, as well as Master of Spells Aram Zey dead and his soul imprisoned using nefarious magic. One of the key members of this Aspis strike team was an elf, referred to only by her experiment number in a Conference Z laboratory: 322. As a field-test of her growing abilities, the lead researcher assigned her to the elite strike team and supplied her with a magical lantern that she used to capture Aram Zey’s soul as he died.

From the introduction:

For Tier 1 - 5.

219844.name: Orders From the Gate
219844.description:
From the introduction:

For ages, orcs have lived in the Menador Mountains, in the peaks that now run across the northern and western reaches of Cheliax. Over the course of numerous efforts, Cheliax has thwarted raids and attempted to drive out the orcs, but the Severed Hand tribe’s members and their ancestors have always survived and rebuilt their strength. As the orcs expanded south, they came into conflict with strix who lived in the area. Chelish officials have watched this conflict from afar with amusement and care only that it doesn’t threaten trade through the Menador Gap.

From the introduction:

For Tier 5 - 9.

219845.name: Brain Parasites
219845.description:
STORY
Your ship has crashed and suffered serious damage. It's up to you and your crew-mates to traverse the corridors to repair the ship's core systems and call for help, but be careful because your ship has been invaded by BRAIN PARASITES!

GAME PLAY
Brain Parasites is a tile based game where you explore your ship to complete the goal. Play as one of 6 crew members each with unique stats. Work as a team until the enemy reveals itself.
Open one of 36 rooms each holding a new surprise as you fight for tech and increase your skills. Will your team survive, or will the alien creature claim the vessel?

219846.name: All For Immortality, Part 2: All the Gods Beyond
219846.description:
From the introduction:

The Pathfinder Society has thwarted many Aspis schemes over the past year, managing to uncover the existence of a dangerous faction known as the Korholm Agenda. The half-orc Suliji Peshar has overseen its operations, maneuvering it first to make herself rich but also to reignite hostilities between the Pathfinder Society and Aspis Consortium—both of which have brokered a secret truce in order to root out their common enemy. Recently, a team of elite Pathfinders—presumably the PCs—traveled to Thuvia, where they uncovered and thwarted an attempt by Suliji’s agents to steal the legendary sun orchid elixir, a much coveted draught that restores youth to the imbiber. In the process, the Pathfinders uncovered a critical connection to one Professor Kramolag, a cutting edge researcher who appeared to work for the Consortium. Aspis contacts found no record of her and so investigated independently by sending a team to one of Kramolag’s secondary facilities in eastern Nidal.

From the introduction:

For Tier 12 - 15.

219847.name: Beyond Azlant Ridge
219847.description:
From the introduction:

Six years ago, a group of Pathfinder archeologists at a remote dig site in the Terwa Uplands made an incredible discovery: clear evidence of Azlanti occupation, refuting the common belief that the Azlanti had no settlements in the Mwangi Expanse. The archeologists came under frequent attacks by the charauka, the vile ape-men of the Mwangi. The Pathfinder expedition’s leader, Juliet Dias, directed construction of a wooden palisade, but the charau-ka called forth an enormous Abyss-touched champion to smash through it. Fortuitously, visiting Pathfinders activated one of the site’s ancient defenses—an enormous iron golem. This golem defeated the vile champion and scattered the attacking charau-ka. The attack also scared off the historical researchers, who hastily covered up the site and vowed never to return.

From the introduction:

For Tier 3 - 7.

219848.name: Mr. Speedy
219848.description:
From cassette inlay
A fast-moving comical game involving skill and strategy. MR. SPEEDU has been told to paint a large area composed of many discs and concealed hazards

219849.name: Ageless Ambitions
219849.description:
From the introduction:

Over the past decade, the Pathfinder Society has enjoyed several noteworthy regional victories against the Aspis Consortium-foiling Aspis alliances in Varisia, thwarting its attempt to fix a tournament’s outcome in Goka, kicking the Consortium out of the Hao Jin Tapestry demiplane, and generally being a thorn in its side. Not all Aspis agents have taken these setbacks quietly, and malcontents (some survivors of the past failed operations) began devising their own drastic response to the Society’s success. Six of these figures convened in Molthune and established the Korholm Agenda, a rebellious faction within the Aspis Consortium set on retaliating against the Society directly. In 4715 ar, they organized and launched an attack on the Grand Lodge itself, damaging the Hao Jin Tapestry and killing the Master of Spells in the process.

From the introduction:

For Tier 7 - 11.

219850.name: Lost Folios of the Book of Creation #1: Adventure Title Generator
219850.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lost Folios of the Book of Creation is a supplement for Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells but can be used with any other fantasy RPG.

This first release contains a Adventure Title Generator and a few Title Examples, demonstrating how you can use them and how can they inspire your campaign.

219851.name: All for Immortality, Part 3: Serpents Fall
219851.description:
From the introduction:

For decades, the Pathfinder Society and the Aspis Consortium have clashed with one another. Usually these skirmishes occur far from either’s headquarters, where a handful of daring agents might fight within an unexplored ruin beneath the veil of plausible deniability. It’s a proud tradition that has kept the conflicts restricted to personal rivalries that rarely touch the rest of their respective institutions.

From the introduction:

For Tier 12 - 15.

219854.name: Dino Kontra Dino
219854.description:
The game contains 45 dinosaur and 30 event cards.

The aim of the game is to complete as many event cards as possible, the game goes on until a player plays the last card of his / her hand.
During a turn each player has 3 cards in his hand, selects one, and then in its place draws a new one. At the beginning of each round is a new event is drawn, each player then plays one card face down. Then, at the same time they all reveal that card. Events cards are then resolved depending on the icon features on the dinosaur cards.

The player who completes the most events wins.

219855.name: Shadow Magic
219855.description:
From the introduction:

From the beginning of time, shadows have been respected and feared. Darkness brings a tingle to the spine, reminding us of a time when we felt trapped without light and the darkness itself seemed a predator to fear.

219856.name: Book of Lairs Maps
219856.description:
User summary:

An extensive collection of full-color, print-and-play maps for use with Book of Lairs. Maps are provided in two versions - one with standard one-inch grid, and one without. While the cover and credits pages are standard letter, the map pages themselves are twenty-four by thirty-six inches.

219857.name: Ilmara's Scrying Stones
219857.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This...showcases four unique crystal ball variants for use in any Forgotten Realms campaign. The magic items detailed are as follows:


Mentor's Mythalglass;
Raanaghaun's Soulshard;
Spellglobe of Hlithal; and
Watch Crystal of Alathas.

219858.name: Enchanting Elixirs
219858.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In memory of some of the great articles showcased in Dragon Magazine over the years, this article is the first in a series that will showcase lore and new magic from the Forgotten Realms campaign setting.

219859.name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Movies
219859.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 2 is movies themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

219860.name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Video Games
219860.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 3 is video games themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

219861.name: Mansfield with Monsters
219861.description:
A LARP for 13 Players

From the introduction:

Wellington 1919. It has been many months since the dread Haitian 'Flu arrived in New Zealand. Tens of thousands have died, if not from the 'flu itself then from the depredations of those who succumbed to the disease only to rise from the grave with an insatiable hunger for human flesh.

The Government responded by enacting curfews and rationing measures. The army set up safe zones guarded by machine guns and barbed wire where the living might continue with their business. Those who wander outside the safe zones risk being torn apart by the living dead.

Still one shouldn't let the fact that the dead are returning to life in contravention of the very laws of nature get one down. Many of the city's well-to-do are doing their best to carry on as if there wasn't an apocalypse on their doorstep. In this spirit of brave defiance Dr and Mrs Harry Young are holding a dinner party for a number of their closest friends.

User summary:

The PDF version is available as a ZIP archive download containing multiple PDF documents that total 46 pages.

219862.name: The Bell
219862.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You wake up with your memories fracturing around you. You're going somewhere, and there's something wrong, and you know these people here with you, or maybe you only think you do. All you really know for sure is that you can hear this Bell.

This is a science fiction suspense live roleplaying game inspired by The Fountain (Darren Aronofsky), Five-Twelfths of Heaven (Melissa Scott), Vacuum Flowers (Michael Swanwick) and the works of Cordwainer Smith. The Bell is intended to be an emotionally intense game that pushes moral dilemmas. (It isn’t recommended for novice roleplayers.) It can be run for 12 to 20 players with a play duration of two hours.

The premise of The Bell is that the players are the crew and passengers of a space ship called The Soul which is travelling to a planet called Castilia and experiencing technical problems. People are normally put to sleep for the journey, with the crew waking for short periods from time to time to make repairs that the ship cannot handle by itself. In this case, the ship is damaged with problems with critical systems. The players wake as amnesiacs with only partial memories about who they are and why they are there. At several points in the game they will hear a tolling bell indicating that they have to return to their sleeper pods for the next phase of the journey. In these bell interludes they will be able to recover more memories about themselves and other people.

The Bell draws on a trope of science fiction which treats space travel as a spiritual journey. It doesn't make assertions about any particular religion, but it does examine metaphysical themes and ethical issues.

User summary:

The game consists of a 194-page manual with character sheets and handouts, and an MP3 soundtrack.

219863.name: The Devil's Brood
219863.description:
A Plantagenet Family Drama LARP

From the introduction:

Christmas 1183: King Henry of England, the most powerful king in Christendom, has summoned his family together at Chinon to celebrate Christmas. The King of France will be in attendance, and the Queen has been released from prison for the occasion. But behind the celebration, Henry's empire is in crisis. The death of his eldest son has placed the succession in doubt, the Queen has been imprisoned for the last decade, his children war incessantly among themselves, and France waits greedily to regain what it has lost.

The Devil’s Brood is a discourse-based political larp for nine players. Expected play time is two to three hours.

User summary:

The game is available for download as a ZIP archive containing multiple PDF files, totaling thirty-seven pages, a DOC file with name tags for print-and-play use, and a JPG map file.

219869.name: Combat Medic: Special Ops
219869.description:
User Summary

Legacy Interactive's Combat Medic: Special Ops is basically a cross between an action game and a puzzle game.

219870.name: Depth Dwellers
219870.description:
The player is assigned to journey into the Zendle mines to accomplish what his beloved Princess Aurora could not: to rescue the Depth Dwelling men of Ora from the Ri of Riase.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depth_Dwellers Depth Dwellers]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219871.name: Space Bunnies Must Die!
219871.description:
Space Bunnies Must Die! has the tried-and-true run-jump-climb-shoot-dance style of gameplay reminiscent of the early Tomb Raider series. The game has nine levels of varying levels of difficulty. On successfully completing those levels, there is a final level, finishing which the game ends.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Bunnies_Must_Die%21 Space Bunnies Must Die!]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219872.name: Mag-Racer
219872.description:
User Summary

A DOS racing game in which the player controls a toy car racing around toy shop tracks.

219873.name: Catechumen
219873.description:
The game's opening cutscene reveals that the player's mentor and brethren have been captured by demon-possessed Roman soldiers and locked in the deepest Roman catacombs. Being a Catechumen, it is the player's job to delve into the Roman catacombs to free them. With the help of various angels, the player eventually frees his brethren at the end of the game by banishing the leader of the demons, Satan, back into the underworld.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catechumen_%28video_game%29 Catechumen (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

219874.name: CyberGladiators
219874.description:
User Summary

In a freak accident, Alliance members of a Gy Djin terrorist attack were transformed into CyberGladiators, a powerful cyborg fighting force.

219875.name: Winter Race 3D
219875.description:
User Summary

Winter Race 3D is a sports game which simulates skiing, snowboard and snowmobile races in a 1st person perspective. The game is arcade oriented, which means that the controls are limited to left, right, more speed or less speed. Only in the snowboard races the player can do stunts while jumping to gain bonus time which gets offset against his end time.

219876.name: SpeedRage
219876.description:
User Summary

SpeedRage is an arcade racing game with shooter elements. You can choose between two different racing types (water and land): Speed Boat or Dune Buggy. As in many earlier racing games, you view your vehicle from behind.

219877.name: Sausage Sprint
219877.description:
Simple race game. Roll a die and move along the track. The track is a string of sausages. Obey the instructions should you land on a designated space. First to reach the dog's hide-out, wins.

The game features two characters from the Disney film Oliver & Company, Oliver and Dodger. It appears in the Disney and Me Annual 2000.

219878.description:
Keep track of your wounds and potions in style. These colored acrylic tokens are the perfect accessory for Hero who likes to adventure in style.

Contents:
30x Heart Tokens
10x Potion Tokens
219878.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Heart and Potion Token Pack

219880.description:
These metal coins replace the cardboard coins contained in 7 Wonders: Duel. The Repos edition comes with a 7 Wonders: Duel collector's bag.

Two sets of those are required to play the original 7 Wonders.

Contains:
14 x 1 credit, 10 x 3 credits et 7 x 6 credits
219880.name: 7 Wonders Duel: Metal Coins

219881.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gambler Hero Pack
219881.description: Based on gamblers in the old west. Comes with male and female gambler models along with rules, gear cards, ability cards, and skill trees.

219882.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wandering Samurai Hero Pack
219882.description: Meant as a preview of their second Kickstarter, Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress, this hero was part of the Kickstarter for the original game. Comes with male and female Wandering Samurai models along with rules, gear cards, ability cards, and skill trees.

219883.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Shaman Hero Pack
219883.description: With the ability to transform into a vicious bear or a dangerous wolf, the Dark Stone Shaman is unique among Shadows of Brimstone's classes. Comes with male and female Dark Stone Shaman models along with bear and wolf models and rules, gear cards, ability cards, and skill trees.

219898.name: Opus Armatum: Research & Destroy
219898.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wenn alles gesagt ist, so lasst die Waffen sprechen.

Was brauchen wir - Bleispritzen? Plasmawummen? Railguns? Automatikkanonen? Lasergeschütze? Scharfschützenschießprügel? Partikelpumpen? Granaten? Nukes? Messer? Angespitzte Stöcke? Oder gleich die ganze verdammte mechanisierte Kavallerie? Hier ist ein Hinweis für jene, die unter einem Stein geschlafen haben und gerade erst aufgewacht sind: Wir werden ALLES brauchen! Denn auf der Erde herrscht jetzt KRIEG - und dazu noch sogar der erste sinnvolle Krieg der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte. Willkommen in der Zukunft, Soldat. Hier geht es zur Waffenkammer.

Opus Armatum - R & D ist das definitive Ausrüstungshandbuch für das Taktische UFO-Rollenspiel. In diesem Kompendium finden Spieler und Spielleiter Erweiterungsregeln für Kämpfe mit Exoskeletten, die Fernsteuerung von Drohnen, Hacking, Fahrzeugumbauten, Waffenmodifikationen, Kampfkünste, das rapide Resolutions-System (RRS) für NSC-Missionen, ein um die Technologiestufe 4 und zahlreiche neue Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekte erweitertes BMS, umfassende Ausrüstungslisten mit hunderten von Waffen, Rüstungen, Fahrzeugen und vieles, vieles mehr!

219899.name: Fire Emblem Heroes
219899.description:
The world of Fire Emblem HeroesA world with two kingdoms: the Emblian Empire, which wishes to rule all worlds, and the Askran Kingdom, which stands in its way.
You are a summoner with the special ability to call upon legendary Heroes from different Fire Emblem worlds. In order to save the Kingdom of Askr from destruction, join the Order of Heroes and face a never-ending challenge.

Source: The Game Website.
Battles
Take part in strategic turn-based battles streamlined for on-the-go play with maps that fit in the palm of your hand! Lead your army with easy touch and drag controls, including the ability to attack by simply swiping an ally over an enemy.

Types
Each Hero has a color type. This color type determines weapon advantages and disadvantages that affect your attack power. If you want battles to go in your favor, build your team with Heroes that have an advantage over the enemy!

Specials
Specials are critical moves you choose for your Heroes. They will undoubtedly prove powerful on the battlefield.

Summon HeroesUse Orbs to summon Heroes that will fight for you. Five colored summoning stones are randomly generated, allowing you to summon a Hero based on their color type. You can obtain Orbs by clearing story maps or purchasing them through the Shop.

Allies
You can customize your allies and create teams to use in battle. From this menu, you can also learn new skills, change equipment, and take the abilities of your Heroes to new heights.

Skills
Use SP (Skill Points) gained by defeating enemies or leveling to obtain new skills. There are three types of active skills: Weapon, Assist, and Special. There are also passive skills, which give you a boost just by equipping them.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgameintegration: Racławice 1794
Racławice 1794
219900.description:
Free DTP war game.

The game "Niemenczyn 1794" recreates a skirmish, which occurred on 27th April 1794 near Vilnius. Polish unit of Lieutenant Colonel Stefan Grabowski attacked outnumbered force of Lieutenant Colonel Lewiz. The insurgents lost the clash. Board war game “Niemenczyn 1794” gives you the opportunity to lead Polish and Russian forces that fought against each other. An alternative scenario allows players to see how the battle could have turned out if more insurrectionary cavalry had taken part. Will the Poles enter the enemy camp? Or will the Polish attacks be stopped by Russian musket and artillery fire? The outcome of that battle is in your hands.

Rules of the game utilize the proven mechanisms of the games of the battles of the Kosciuszko Uprising ("Raclawice 1794", "Szczekociny 1794" and "Maciejowice 1794"). Due to the small amount of counters, "Niemenczyn 1794" is a good introduction to these games.
219900.name: Niemenczyn 1794

219901.name: Tao Long: The Way of the Dragon – 4 Player Expansion
219901.description: The 4 Player Expansion adds a team based mode where each team shares their fire and water tokens.

219902.name: Tao Long: The Four Seasons
219902.description: Each season represents seemingly simple bends on the basic rules that profoundly affect gameplay and strategy.

219906.name: Footsoldiers
219906.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Day is a Good Day to Die

There is battle, and then there is warfare. Many adventurers are familiar with wading into combat against monsters and small groups of enemies, but this is nothing next to the glory and chaos and carnage that is true war. More than simply a change in scale, the difference between war and other combat can be profound. In a war, the characters are part of something larger than themselves, contributing to the efforts of their armies, or perhaps leading those armies themselves. The priorities of a soldier are different from those of an adventurer, and often the challenges that they face are, as well. While many characters can translate their talents as adventurers to the battlefield, one who specifically focuses on warfare and battlefield tactics will have the edge on others when it comes to true war. Each installment of Weekly Wonders: Archetypes of War provides six new war-themed archetypes for a variety of classes.

For this book, we focus on archetypes of the common soldier. These brave men and women comprise the bulk of every army, and it is through their hard work, courage, and determination that an army is able to accomplish anything at all. While it may not be glamorous to be one of the grunts, these tough-as-nails soldiers are nonetheless each a hero in their own right. This book includes the following archetypes:

The military bloodline, for bloodragers with a long ancestry of soldiering and war, who find unnatural combat instincts and training seem to come to them suddenly in the haze of battle.
The versatile combatant, a brawler archetype that retains its incredible flexibility in combat, while focusing on fighting with more traditional arms and armor, rather than unarmed strikes.
The career soldier, a fighter archetype that replaces bravery with a series of minor benefits, allowing them to march, take cover, flank, and charge more effectively.
The battle mage, a magus archetype that specializes in the manipulation of raw arcane energy to blast foes, or create barriers to help hold the line.
The military discipline, a psychic discipline for those whose psychic abilities come from military programs to create psychic soldiers.
The warmonger, a warpriest archetype for those that worship battle above all, and trade out some of their healing powers for the ability to better make war.




Whether you're about to embark on a campaign of military exploits (such as the official Paizo adventure path dealing with invading forces), or you just want to play a more military character, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for militarily-inclined NPCs as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

219907.name: Rifts Primer: How to Play Rifts and Create Adventures
219907.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carl Gleba and Kevin Siembieda join forces to create a tour de force of information about Game Mastering games and creating adventures. This primer should help both G.M.s and players enjoy the storytelling experience of role-playing games, as well as helping them better understand the game rules. The second adventure, Rescue the Rogue Scholar, should help aspiring Game Masters with the creation of adventures and plot.

Sections include:

Getting Started, The Game Master
More Game Master Tips and Tricks
Player Character Tips
A Rifts® Adventure by Gleba and Siembieda
Rifts® Combat Terms (and examples)
Damage and the M.D.C. System
Combat Recap
The Bandits
The Town of River Side
Non-Player Characters (NPCs)
The Player Characters
Adventure Building: Rescue the Rogue Scholar
Keeping it All Organized




Note: This Primer originally appeared in The Rifter® #75.

219908.name: Oh, Deer!
219908.description:
Oh, Deer! is a driving game -- not a racing game! -- for those who want weird, snappy drifts, blue skies, weird graphics, and hot, aggressive music.

In Oh, Deer! the object is to hit as many or as few deer as possible, while making it to grandma's house within the time limit. Isn't it time people started making games about the Real Issues again!? This is a true pseudo-3D driving game, pushing lots of sprites, with camera tilt, hills, hot drifting, the whole 9 yards. Oh hey and we've got music from Motohiro Kawashima of Streets of Rage 3 fame.

Source: The Developer Website.

219909.name: A Frightful Time (5E)
219909.description:
From publisher blurb:

CALLING ALL BEGINNER 5TH EDITION PLAYERS!

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for beginner players and game masters, 4 PCs of levels 1-2 Fall into heroism!

The young heroes from Exallizar Preparatory Academy are back for their second adventure – and this time, there’s no safety net. A nearby town has sent out a call for aid after a mad hermit has promised to spread untold misery during their yearly harvest celebration. Your group has been selected by the administration to answer that call, and act as representatives for the entire school! You dare not fail.

“A Frightful Time” includes:

The second leg of the adventure started in BASIC01
The return of Ronus, Willow, Meeris, and Kale, fully upgraded to level 2
A new breed of monster that is sure to be an instant seasonal classic
A grading system to let you know how well you’ve done at the end of the adventure
Part of a series of seasonally thematic modules, BASIC02 can be run to completion in 3-6 hours

219910.name: The Ascent of Tempest Tower (5E)
219910.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mini-Dungeon adventure for three to four Level 20 Characters

Tempest Tower is a spire that reaches skyward from an expanse of open plains. The stone monument rises nearly 100-feet above mostly-featureless terrain. At its apex swirls a maelstrom of storm clouds that extend half-a-mile from the center. The landscape directly below is speckled with small craters and charred vegetation from frequent lightning strikes. The sound of rolling thunder is near constant and can be heard for miles in every direction.

The tower was constructed eons past to bind a powerful monstrosity from the elemental plain of air known as the Storm Song which once roamed across these lands, consuming the greenery and the earth in which it was rooted – creating the vast, featureless plains that now exists.

219911.name: Race Pack One: Rodentkin
219911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Small? Yes.
Cute? Sometimes.
Ready for Adventure? ALWAYS!

Start your journey as one of the three races of The Rodentkin: The urban and clever Longtails, the desert-roaming and adventurous Sandhoppers, or the pastoral, yet corageous Stoutbottoms!

This product contains:

Three fully-stated new races. With information on culture and optional racial rules.
New feats and traits for Rodentkin players.
New Alchemical discoveries.
New Orcale Mystery: Sand.
New Cavlier Order: The Order of the Beak*
New God: Afance - The Great Beaver.

219912.name: Defend the Village
219912.description:
Defend the Village is a Cooperative Deck-Building game in which 1-5 heroes team up to save a village under distress from low-life bandits and hard-hitting villains! You take turns buying new weapons, potions and helpful items while also fighting off bandits before they destroy all six of your battlegrounds all the while praying you have enough strength to destroy all 5 villains! Do you and your fellow heroes have what it takes to defeat these villains and save this innocent village? Only time will tell…

Each player is dealt a random Hero with their own stats and ability. Each player also starts with the same starting hand. On each players turn they will reveal a card from the bandit deck and then spend the cards from their hand to purchase new items, or fight a Bandit or Villain.

Easy to learn, tough to survive.

219913.name: Save the Wagons!
219913.description:
An Encounter for four to five characters of levels 1st through 3rd

From the introduction:

A caravan of four canvas covered wagons is traveling the Savage Frontier, making its way to another town or settlement within the region. Giants recently came through the area and trampled the homes and gardens of the members of the caravan. The caravan is now under attack by bandits.

219914.name: Blood and Bark
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219914.description:
(user summary)

Systemless mini-sandbox adventure in a surreal fantasy setting, featuring woods that are in fact not woods at all.

219915.name: New Iceland
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219915.description: A Monsterhearts starter set in Gimli, Manitoba.

boardgamecompilation: Dark Darker Darkest: Heli Escape Expansion
Dark Darker Darkest: Victims Mini Expansion
219916.description:
The Dark Darker Darkest - Kickstarter Special box was shipped to all Kickstarter backers of the Premium level pledge.

It added some extras: two new survivors, two new creatures, two new nemesis, ten new map tiles, zombies with special abilities and new miniatures (these where also released with the Zombie Expansion), radioactive rules with red models (a sub-set of the Radioactive Expansion), a small survivor expansion (where you find other civilians in the house) and the small Helipad expansion (a new map tile that shows the landing pad, where you have to end up if you wanna escape).

CONTENT:

2 Survivor Boards and Survivor Miniatures Grey with Colored Base
2 Nemesis Boards and Nemesis Miniatures Grey
2 Creature Boards and Creature Miniatures Grey
10 Room Tiles (6X Inner Rooms, 4X Outer Rooms)
2 Entrap Tokens
8 Skill Tokens
7 Marker Cubes
10 Equipment Cards
7 Glow In The Dark Creature Dice
10 Glow In The Dark Standard Zombie Miniatures
Dark Darker Darkest: Zombie Expansion (contains 40 Spawn Tokens, 50 Zombie Miniatures Grey: 10 each of Standards, Guts, Disco Dolls, Chunk, and Tuff Guy)
Dark Darker Darkest: Survivor Dice Expansion (contains 20 Survivor dice, 5 sets of 4 in each base survivor color)
RadioactiveRed Survivor/Nemesis expansion (contains 1 Room Tile, 27 Radiation Markers, 10 Equipment Cards, 7 Survivor Miniatures Red with Colored Base, 4 Nemesis Miniatures Red) (This is a subset of Dark Darker Darkest: Radioactive Expansion)
Dark Darker Darkest: Victims Mini Expansion (contains 3 Victim Tokens)
Dark Darker Darkest: Heli Escape Expansion (contains 1 Room Tile)
219916.name: Dark Darker Darkest: Kickstarter Special

rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219917.name: The Blackrock Brothers Abroad, Again
219917.description: A re-imagining of "The Blackrock Brothers Abroad," updated for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition.

219918.name: The Snow Queen's Mirrors
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219918.description:
(user summary)

A systemless winter adventure inspired by Hans Christian Andersen.

219919.name: Of Fauns & Frozen Feet
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219919.description:
(user summary)

A Pathfinder-compatible hexcrawl for 4-6 adventurers of levels 4-5, suitable for dropping into a winter campaign.

219920.name: Corporate Ladder
219920.description:
Description from the designer:

Become CEO by tricking your coworkers!

Corporate Ladder is a card game of deal-making, bluffing, and office humor for 2-6 players. Negotiate with your co-workers on what performance review cards you each will play. Equal cards give you both a Promotion and move you up the corporate ladder, but be careful: a worse card will give you a Warning and push you towards an early retirement.

Think your rival is going to betray you? Sneakily call in a favor from your rolodex by playing a business card to gain an unfair advantage.

Dole out enough Warnings to get your competitors fired or earn enough Promotions to rise to CEO and win the game!

219921.name: The River's Revival
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219921.description:
(user summary)

A winter adventure for the Window system, in which the players attempt to defeat a powerful sorcerer.

219922.name: Ice Not Nice
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219922.description:
(user summary)

A feature film wherein the characters are trapped in the fridge, due to a rogue miniaturizer module.

219923.name: 2 Hot 2 Handle
videogamecompilation: Ivan Iron Man Stewart's Super Off Road
219923.description:
User Summary
A box set by Ocean containing four popular games. The games were originally developped and published by various companies, including Ocean self (Total Recall)

219924.name: Sierra Soccer: World Challenge Edition
219924.description:
User Summary
Football/Soccer game produced with the World Cup 1994 in USA in mind.

219925.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Allies of Necessity
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG
219925.description:
Description from the publisher:

“Do you want to know the odds of her using that blaster on you? It’s high. It’s very high.”
–K-2SO, Rogue One

If anything defines the Star Wars saga more than the lightsaber duels, blaster firefights, and epic space battles, it’s the friendships that emerge out of hardship and necessity. Whether it’s Luke Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi looking for a smuggler to take them offworld or ex-convict Jyn Erso forced to work with a ragtag group of Rebels, outcasts, and Imperial defectors, these alliances can determine the fate of the entire galaxy.

Within Allies of Necessity and the new Alliances cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game, you gain plenty of incentives to bring multiple affiliations together. While multi-affiliation decks have always been a possibility, Allies of Necessity offers more tools to help you than ever before—starting with new affiliation cards, which offer new deckbuilding requirements and special abilities. What’s more, you’ll find iconic characters from Rogue One, Star Wars Rebels, and the Darth Vader comics throughout the cycle: in fact, this first Force Pack includes Doctor Aphra, Director Krennic, Captain Cassian Andor, and Jyn Erso.

With eight new objective sets (two copies each of four distinct sets), and twelve brand-new affiliation cards (two for each affiliation), Allies of Necessity promises to change your games like never before!

219926.description:
A point to point block game that allows gamers to refight the final phase of Grant's 1863 Vicksburg Campaign. 1 Player is Grant and his Army of the Tennessee. The other player commands the armies led by Pemberton and Johnston, which can be split allowing for a three player game.

Gamers can refight the entire campaign in 2 hours or under. Low unit counts, and short turns create great tension, decision making, and high player interaction.

Each game comes with a sturdy card stock map, blocks and labels, dice, short 8 page series rules, and game specific rules.
219926.name: Pemberton & Grant: Vicksburg Campaign of 1863

219928.name: 10 Useful Dungeons #01
219928.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

10 useful Dungeons #01 consists of maps and handouts of various dungeons.

Each map from the set provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

219929.name: Acrobat Feats
219929.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Need some more feats for your Heroes Wear Mask games, well Avalon has them for you with our Feat Book Series. Each book is packed full of new feats for your game, each focused on a Class within the system.

This time around we have 20 feats for the Acrobat class. So leap higher, jump better and dodge bullets with crazy glee.

219930.name: Avalon Newsletter (Vol. 1, Issue 15 - Nov 2016)
219930.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Avalon Game’s Newsletter. This month we have some Sci-Fi-based goodies for you with the release of new Infinite Future fun and a Kung Fu Kuma adventure, and of course new Pathfinder goodies. Included are new art sets and other great gaming accessories for you to enjoy.

Join the best fans in the world and play a game by Avalon.

219931.name: Avalon Newsletter (Vol. 1, Issue 16 - Dec 2016)
219931.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Avalon Game’s Newsletter. This month we have some Sci-Fi-based goodies for you with the release of new Infinite Future fun and of course new Pathfinder goodies. Included are new art sets and other great gaming accessories for you to enjoy.

Join the best fans in the world and play a game by Avalon

219932.name: Avalon Newsletter (Vol. 2, Issue 1 - Jan 2017)
219932.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Avalon Games Newsletter. This month we have some Sci-Fi-based goodies for you with the release of new Infinite Future fun and of course new Pathfinder goodies. Included are new art sets and other great gaming accessories for you to enjoy.

Join the best fans in the world and play a game by Avalon.

219933.name: Avalon Newsletter (Vol. 2, Issue 2 - Feb 2017)
219933.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Avalon Game’s Newsletter. This month we have some Sci-Fi-based goodies for you with the release of new Infinite Future fun and of course new Pathfinder goodies. Included are new art sets and other great gaming accessories for you to enjoy.

Join the best fans in the world and play a game by Avalon.

219934.name: Time Assassin
219934.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

CLASSifieds: The Time Assassin (New Base Class)

A time assassin is a master of altering her personal movement through time. With her knowledge and understanding of its flux, she can pull duplicates of herself through time and space to aid her in her endeavors and see into the near future of herself and her opponents. The time assassin is a grand manipulator time and the perception of others; eventually becoming its master, allowing her to ignore the effects others may place on time.

Role: A time assassin is the master of stealth and quick elimination. With the ability to manifest multiple duplicates of herself she can quickly overwhelm her opponents. Additionally, the time assassin has the ability to move objects through time as well as increase or decrease the efficacy of creatures in select areas through the usage of temporal rifts. However, if the time assassin uses her abilities gratuitously she will quickly run herself out of resources and, thusly, her ability to affect time.

Play a Time Assassin and enjoy abilities and powers that allow you to manipulate time itself!

Paradox - The class feature that gives you control of the possible futures in a battle!
Predictive Knowledge - the powerful class feature that gives you a glimpse into the future!
Time Split - pull other versions of yourself into battle, increasing your odds of success!
Archetypes - The mysterious Time Madness and Focuser archetypes allow you to customize your build even more!

219935.name: Bit Blaster XL
219935.description:
BIT BLASTER is an awesome, addictive, and fast paced arcade shoot 'em up! (shmup)
How to play: Touch the screen on the left to turn left, touch the screen on the right to turn right. Aim and shoot all enemies while collecting power ups and coins, Avoid a clash with enemies or the walls to survive as long as you can.

Source: The Developer Website.

219936.name: The Winter Warlock's Revenge
rpgseries: RPG Geek Winter Wonderland Adventure Contest
219936.description:
(user summary)

A generic fantasy adventure, wherein the Winter Warlock attempts to ruin the winter festival in the tiny town of Anscroft.

219937.name: Argonauts: Science for the Greater Good
219937.description:
From publisher blurb:

Argonauts is a sourcebook for Eclipse Phase players and gamemasters:

Discover the history and secrets of the Argonauts, transhumanity’s foremost scientific organization.
Organization and Politics: Understand the people and policies driving this faction.
Super Science: Learn about Argonaut projects in science and engineering.
Playing Argonauts: See how Argonaut characters bring contacts and expertise to PC teams.
Plot Hooks: Introduce Argonaut NPCs and faction-related intrigues to your campaign.

219938.name: Into the Outside
219938.description:
From the introduction:

The eight previous worlds have left the Earth awash in the transdimensional. Devices, prior-world structures, and even many of the creatures featured in the Numenera corebook, like the abykos and the Nibovian wife, are entities that exist partially out of phase or hail entirely from another plane. At least one of the prior worlds explored and harnessed alternate dimensions as a means for increasing their own power and knowledge. Many of these entrances and exits still remain.

219940.name: I've Brought You Back a Baby Dragon
219940.description:
Board game in which people go off on a trip and have to bring back ice cream, postcards and purple dragons. You go round the board (with some choice as to where you go), nip into shops picking up souvenirs, and head home when you have a full set.

The other players are both racing against you and can occasionally swap what you have with someone else.

The board is a work of art, and the pieces are typical tourists with flowery hats and cameras.

The game comes with a dice for movement and to help you escape the task of browsing in a shop.

The board has symbols, so the game should be playable in any language with a set of rules in that language.

The rules are simple and complete. You can learn the game in about 2-3 minutes, and there are no surprises (e.g. odd exceptions) so the game flows well.

219941.name: Breachworld Game Mechanics Folio #1: Achievements
219941.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement provides additional optional rules for the Breachworld RPG, known as Achievements. Including these special incentives will provide extra variety to the incredibly fun gaming experience already inherent in Mini Six.

Included in this supplement:

Two sets of Achievements, one for characters who skew toward the "good" side of the spectrum and one for those who prefer the "bad."
Ideas and notes on how to expand or modify the system on your own.

219942.name: Star Wars: Trivia Box
219942.description: The game features a series of challenging trivia questions. Players alternate turns asking questions and earning Star Wars picture cards for correct answers. There is also a "steal" mechanic that allows opponents to steal each others' cards. The first player to earn four picture cards wins the game.

219943.name: Starjammer
219943.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Void. Welcome to Starjammer!

Some people look to the stars and wonder what they are, what they mean, and what is out there.

Your characters are about to find out.

Welcome to Starjammer, a wild ride through the void built upon and compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This tome is over 200 pages of star-exploring options, including:

Four new player character races including the Abiarazi (shapechanging oozes), the Manu (innovative crafters of magitech), the Pasimachi (a beetle-like hive race with a wealth of genetic variations(, and the Transgenics (half human/half alien nomads)!
A toolbox approach to creating and customizing your own spacefaring vessels to travel the stars as explorers, traders, pirates, mercenaries, or even as a part of an organized space fleet!
New racial options, archetypes, and traits for all of the new races as well as for the core Pathfinder Roleplaying Game races!
Additional uses for skills, plus new skills to use technology!
New class archetypes including helical healer (cleric), shock trooper (fighter), and void tracker (ranger)!
New racial and class features to specialize your characters for their journeys away from their home planets, such as the Infinity Oracle Mystery, Elven Rocketjocks, and much more!
Unique Roles for space vessel crewmembers, specialized crew roles, and synergies between officers that grant benefits to the crew!
Factions of the Void, including the knowledge-seeking Bastion Incantorum, the militaristic Infinite Star Legion, the charismatic Israfel Order, the avaricious Red Tang Spice Guild, and the preservationist Shaman Knights.
New rules for skills used in space, including Craft (vessel), Knowledge (geography), and Profession (pilot)!
Over a dozen new feats for PCs in space!
New equipment for space-based adventures including magnetic shields, misfortune lanterns, hardsuits, dwarven steam suits, star marine armor, and more!
Over a dozen new spells to survive in or control the void around you!
Environmental hazards of space and space travel including antimagic fields, asteroid fields/meteor showers, comets, dust clouds, nebulae, Oort clouds, radiation belts, ribbon storms, solar flares, wormholes, and more!
Rules for planet shapes, environments, and classifications!
A sample gazetteer to spark your imagination when creating your own bold new worlds!




Take to the stars and begin your adventures either on your own or with a hearty crew of brave friends.

Explore the infinite reaches of the void or bring a bit of the stars to the games at your own table today!

219944.name: Snow Day
219944.description:
The weather outside is frightful! After a day of outside play in the snow, its time to race home. You and your friends split up and head to your respective homes, trying to get there first. Snowballs thrown by your opponents and the blistering cold will slow you down, and if you're not careful, you might freeze before you arrive.

Snow Day has players creating Paths with cards, hoping to create a route from their origin point to their Home. Each turn, a player places a new Path card from a draw pile or manipulates an existing Path, then rolls a Movement Die to determine their movement, and finally accounts for their loss in body temperature. The game acts as a race against both your friends and the weather itself, as players lose temperature on each turn. If their temperature reaches zero, they're frozen solid and eliminated from the competition.

Players can disrupt one another's paths as a defensive move, at the potential cost of their own path development. Special Path cards also allow for a player to chuck an imaginary Snowball at an opponent, speeding up their friend's freezing process. The first player to arrive to their home before freezing is the winner.

219945.name: Husk
219945.description:
Husk is a down-to-earth survival-horror, about harm, pain and seeking forgiveness in Shivercliff, a town abandoned for unknown reasons.
A tribute to classical thrillers like Silent Hill or Twin Peaks.

It's 1995, you’re Matthew Palmer and you’ve just woken up after a train crash. There's nobody around you. Especially, there’s no trace of your wife and daughter.
The only sign indicating where you are says:
Welcome to Shivercliﬀ.

Features:
- Down-to-earth storyline touching problems of violence and alcohol addiction
- Immersive narration
- 90's climate with a lot of references
- Inspired by titles like Silent Hill or Alan Wake
- Different locations of Shivercliff town and its surroundings
- Different types of monsters and boss fights
- Classical survival horror
- Dedicated soundtrack created by Arkadiusz Reikowski
- 4-5 hours of gameplay
- Powered by Unreal Engine 4

Source: The Developer Website.

219946.name: Coriolis Gamemaster Screen
219946.description:
User summary:

This three-panel screen is intended to be printed in landscape format for print-and-play use. The player side has a continuous image. The gamemaster side has several commonly-used tables.

Note the unusual page size.

219947.name: Coriolis Character Sheet
219947.description:
User summary:

The character sheet is presented as a full-color sheet, intended for print-and-play use. The PDF is distributed as a "form", allowing field data entry prior to printing.

219948.name: Coriolis: The Third Horizon
219948.description:
Free League

From the introduction:

Coriolis – The Third Horizon is a role-playing game set in space. There are ships, space stations and starry vistas, just like in any other space-themed RPG. What separates Coriolis from other sci-fi RPGs is first and foremost the social environment, which in Coriolis is strongly inspired by the Middle East.

219949.name: Coriolis: Atlas Compendium
219949.description:
Free League

From the introduction:

Algol, the demon star, is home to plebeians and rebels. The planet is known for its heavy industry, deep mines, vast wastelands and draconian faction and Consortium-affiliated rulers. The industrial expansion has taken its toll on both the planet and its inhabitants, leaving the people divided between company loyalists and rebels.

219950.name: Barbarians & Empires
219950.description:
BARBARIANS & EMPIRES - OCCIDENT ARENA, takes you and your fellow players to the ancient world at the beginning of the third century BC. In this edition you are fighting for the supremacy in the western Mediterranean and Western Europe, the geographical area which the Romans and Byzantines designated as Occident. In the western Mediterranean powers, the Greeks, the Carthagians and the Romans compete for hegemony; in the north are powerful nations such as the Celts, Germans, and Dacians, who, if they are not at war to each other, aspire to the warm, sweet and rich regions of the South. The Iberians fight for their own survival. It was the time shortly after the Celtic storm on Rome, done by Brennus and after the death of Alexander the Great. It was the period of the Punic wars, followed by the beginning of the Germanic invasions of the Cimbri and Teutones, which once again placed Rome at a great danger. They were defeated only by consul Marius after his military reforms. Now you play for the supremacy in the Occident in those last pre-Christian centuries, in which the gates of the Roman Temple of Janus were only closed once. Choose your people and win!

While playing, you have to successfully develop several skills to win, namely those of a military strategist, a prudent economist and a skilled diplomat. Increase your empire revenue through urban development, conquests and through your navy, which dominates the trade revenue in sea zones. Use your diplomats and support your army leaders or trade with other players, instigate revolts, gain neutral provinces peacefully, manipulate the opposing army commander, or send huge sums of money to support your allies. Secure your domains by garrison troops and fortifications. Build powerful armies, recruit the best of your people to increase the performance of your army, and develop strategies to force your powerful enemies to their knees. Hope, that Fortuna favors you. May the gods be with you!

Reach the supremacy of your nation in the Occident. You can achieve this dominance by leading the victory-chart at the end of 8 rounds or you can eliminate one of your adversaries in a Deathmatch by conquering his last province. Several winners in different order categories are possible. If a last province of an opponent has been conquered by your army, you place one of your markers on the skulls on the game board. No matter how the game evolves, you are one of the game winners, as long as you do not lose your last province, too. Any player remains in the game until he has completely lost his last province (does not apply to the nation of BRITANNIA, they stay always in the game!)

219951.name: Tyler: Model 005
219951.description:
Tyler: Model-005 is a 3D action-platformer and exploration game set in the 1950s where you control a spunky miniature robot named Tyler. Many years after being shut down, Tyler is accidentally powered up during the height of a thunderstorm.

Source: The Developer Website.

219952.name: EvilMorph
219952.description:
User Summary

Evilmorph – this is a platform game the main feature of which is a transformation into your enemies after killing them.

219953.name: Oldschool tennis
219953.description:
User Summary

In Oldschool Tennis you can set the settings to emulate every version.

219954.name: Wells
219954.description:
Play as Wells, a steampunk hero ready to find an amazing variety of weapons, each unique in design and functionality, and get ready to face a plethora of enemies and challenges.

Source: The Developer Website.

219955.name: Hunt: The Unknown Quarry
219955.description:
Hunt: The Unknown Quarry is a deductive combat game for 3 to 6 players. One is secretly the monster and is trying to cripple the other players in order to escape the mansion. Shared Play: One purchase allows a whole group to play together. Based on the original board game from Victory Point Games.

Source: The Developer Website.

219956.name: ZANGEKI WARP
219956.description:
User Summary

Take control of the hyperdimensional fighter craft ‘ZanFighter’ and use its advanced warp functions to defeat an army of space beasts controlled by an evil scientist!

219957.name: Aquila Bird Flight Simulator
219957.description:
Have you dreamed of what it would be ... to soar like an eagle? Aquila Bird Flight Simulator lets you experience soaring bird flight using the Oculus Rift headset. This is a soaring simulation, so you can make use of ridge lift and thermals like any other soarer in the skies...

Source: The Game Website.

219958.name: HitBox
219958.description:
HitBox is a fast paced, competitive and stylish multiplayer shooter. A minimalist and colorful style enabled high framerates and fast, fluid, third person gameplay, online, locally or in split screen.

Source: The Game Website.

219959.name: Queen of Seas
219959.description:
“Queen of Seas” is a casual platformer game. The game theme is about Yemanjá, the Queen os Seas in afro-brazilian religion. You play as a fisherman’s son, that need to dive deep and deliver offerings to the Queen os Seas as a poof of his family’s faith.

Source: The Developer Website.

219960.name: Causality
219960.description:
Causality is a puzzle game about manipulating time, changing the sequence of events and altering the outcome of each level.

Source: The Developer Website.

219961.name: Legna Tactica
219961.description:
n the lands of Feyzum, where the Kingdom of Legna is drawn into the chaos of battle against the Empire of Izmoot, Leck and his friends Miana and Astar are engaged in field training as trainee soldiers. Suddenly, it is decided that they will accompany the Hero of the Kingdom of Legna, General Varrius, and the Azure Hawk Brigade which he leads, on a mission to suppress the bandits. However, they know nothing of the inescapable destiny that awaits them...

Source: The Publisher Website.

219962.name: Nyheim
219962.description:
Nyheim is a single-player digital boardgame about rebuilding the titular city of Nyheim after a lethal pandemic. As survivors of the disease, your party must explore the districts of Nyheim, face mutated rats, gather supplies and lead the efforts towards a new society!

Source: The Developer Website.

219963.name: FootRock VR
219963.description:
User Summary

Footrock - virtual game for the whole family. You will become a legendary sportsman, who will go through the fascinating and unpredictable levels on football arenas.

219964.name: VRChat
219964.description:
Join our growing community as you explore, play, and help craft the future of social VR. Create worlds and custom avatars. Welcome to VRChat.

Source: The Game Website.

219965.name: Triple Pack: Outland / From Dust / Beyond Good & Evil HD
219965.description:
User Summary
A compilation of 3 games by Ubisoft. This is the only way to own physical copies of Outland, From Dust and the HD remake of Beyond Good & Evil.

219966.name: Packa pappas kappsäck
219966.description:
Swedish memory game for children. Literally "Pack daddy's suitcase".

Players tale turns placing cards, different items, in the "suitcase", creating a new card deck. When all cards have been placed the first player tries to remember in which order the items were placed in the bag. Correct items are kept by the players. If the player makes in incorrect guess, the turn is passed to the next player.

219967.name: Tooth and Nail
219967.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stuff of Nightmares...

These monsters are the stuff of primordial, collective subconscious. They're born of nightmare, and grown through legends of dragons, sphinxes, leviathans, and darker things still.

Some take up the vigil to do battle against the greatest of monsters.

Will you slay the dragons?

Tooth and Nail is a bonus chapter/companion book to the previous released Hunter: Mortal Remains that explores antagonists inspired by the Beast: the Primordial RPG.

Inside you'll find:


Fiction and story hooks to bring these beasts of legend to your Hunter: The Vigil chronicle.
New bestial Dread Powers.
New Compacts and Conspiracies which hunt the monsters, but also sometimes hunt the zealous heroes that hunt as well.

219968.name: Labyrinth: Ersatzplatten
219968.description: 2 new mazes to put on top of the base game to introduce an "easy" and "advanced" difficulty level, but both easier then the base game.

219969.name: Sexy Ninja Death Squad
219969.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sexy Ninja Death Squad (or SNDS for short) is a fast fire card game designed for 2+ players than can last from 15-25 minutes. Players furiously attack each other and defend themselves in order to be the last ninja standing. Each card can be used in attack or defence and placed in the Head, Body or Legs position depending on it's tabs. There is an Active Character Token (or A.C.T.) which signifies the active player. On receiving this you draw one card and can play one card on the players sitting next to you. They then have to block this attack with a card of their own OR give you a hit token (you have 3 of these in the standard game). When you lose a hit token you recharge your hand back up to 5 cards. Lose all 3 and you are defeated.

There are three special indicators which can appear on the cards and these signify 'Flurry', 'Riposte' or 'Ninja Star' cards. When a Flurry card is played in an attack you immediately draw another card and can play another attack card. If another Flurry card is played then you draw and play another attack and so on...

When a Riposte is played in a defence you immediately draw another card and can play an attack card on the player your attacker. If a Flurry card is played then its free second attack can hit any valid player.

The third type of card is the Ninja Star which can attack anyone.

Flurry and Riposte cards chain without limit which means your games get very hectic very quickly. The more people who are playing the more fun it becomes because more players means more ACTs!

It is not uncommon for other players to attempt to kill steal by lobbing a ninja star across the table, or you having to change tactics when your carefully prepared Flurry chain gets blocked and you have Riposte attacks to survive. Sometimes it is better to take the damage, lose a hit token, recharge your hand and come out swinging.

219970.name: Tank Troopers
219970.description:
Storm the battlefield in one of 36 customizable tanks in this tank warfare shooter exclusive to Nintendo eShop. The digital game supports up to six players battling against each other in teams or free-for-all in local multiplayer* matches. Colorful characters with unique personalities, a variety of different maps and modes, and creative challenges combine to make Tank Troopers a fun and engaging multiplayer experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

219971.name: PinOut!
219971.description:
User Summary:

A video-game specific twist on classic pinball; instead of playing on a fixed table, you continually scroll upward to reach new tables and new flippers. Along the way, you grab power-ups, play mini-games and collect time bonuses to extend your play time.

The game features vibrant neon-style graphics and different music tracks on each level.

219973.name: Doodle Delirium
219973.description:
Teams of 2 or more compete to reach the end of the track on the game board. Each turn, one team member rolls a die to determine which of the 4 categories they will attempt.

Oodle Doodles is simple drawing;
Model Madness involves modelling with clay provided in the box;
Paper Mash-Ups has the player folding and tearing paper;
Scribble Riddles requires drawing a phrase, saying or something from popular culture (a song, film or famous person).

The player draws a card from the category that they rolled, and chooses one line from the card. A timer is started, and the other players have to guess what is being drawn or modelled. In some cases, the player is allowed to act and move with the object they are modelling. If the team guess correctly, a miniature representing a marker pen is moved on to the next space of that colour.

Some board spaces have special features. "All Play" means all teams are allowed to guess instead of just the team whose turn it currently is (and move on the board if they guess correctly). "X" means the team moves back by one space if they do not guess correctly. And a "2" means the team has twice the amount of time to guess (the sand timer is turned twice).

To win the game, a team must complete two separate challenges (with two separate rolls of the dice) within the normal time limit, a single turn of the sand timer.

219974.description:
Description from the publisher:

Nightfall at Camp Havenwood is a slasher themed, cooperative survival horror game for 1-5 players. This is the first entry in the Havenwood Horror series. Set in 1985, in the northeastern U.S., you play a group of campers who are fighting for their survival. Several bloodthirsty horrors await you in the woods and you will need to work together to either kill the horror or discover the secrets of the camp that will allow you to survive. Welcome to camp!
219974.name: Havenwood Horror: Nightfall at Camp Havenwood

219976.name: SPARTAN
219976.description:
From publisher blurb:

'“The Police absolutely must continue to evolve and adapt to ever-changing and sometimes unbelievable situations that have arisen time and time again since the dawn of the super human.”

SPARTAN, Super Powered Activity Response Tactics and Neutralization, is a law enforcement team in the city’s police force that specializes in responding to super-powered or extraordinary situations and threats to civil safety. The SPARTAN team is considered the next tier of response after the city’s SWAT units.

SPARTAN contains stats & information for all seven members of the SPARTAN team along with their equipment and support.

219977.name: D.K.
219977.description:
From publisher blurb:

D.K. Pilazzo was an up-and-coming mobster who overshadowed his peers enough they betrayed him. Set up, beaten, shot, and disposed of in toxic chemicals his murderers joked that D.K. "can get to livin' up to his name an' DECAY!"

But he came back. Now D.K. is his own boss, taking out the competition and building his own criminal empire. There will be blood in the streets!

219978.name: Kings Watch
219978.description:
A co-operative medieval crime fighting game, it is a strong story driven co-operative experience, where you take on the role of watchmen trying to find and arrest criminals. When you sit down to play, you pick a case to attempt, some are for beginners while others challenge even the most experienced players.

During your turn you must prioritise either gathering clues, following up leads or hunting out information. Working together is important, as there is limited time to find and arrest the guilty before they escape and you lose. After you’ve finished your turn, a story card is drawn. These cards change the game, moving the suspects, adding special rules and generally making the game tougher.

219980.name: Tunnel B1
219980.description:
Tunnel B1 is a sci-fi first person shooter developed by NEON Software and published by Ocean Software in 1996. It features a soundtrack by Chris Hülsbeck of Turrican fame.

The PlayStation and Sega Saturn ports were released in Japan as 3D Mission Shooting: Finalist

The player character travels through a set of precarious tunnels in a high-tech hovercraft. The tunnels are filled with enemy vehicles, choppers and sentry guns which the player has to take out or avoid. Many sections require the player to clear them in a given time limit. The player can upgrade their weaponry.

Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunnel_B1

219981.name: Inquest (Issue 32 - Dec 1997)
219981.description:
Featured on the cover:
Star Trek Next Generation Killer Deck
Tempest Price Guide and Spoiler List

219982.name: Burgle Bros.: 5 Promo Event Pack
219982.description:
Five all new events designed by the community:
Sliding Wall
Scribbled Note
Over-Caffeinated
Recent Remodel
Not-so-secret Door

219983.name: Sword of Kings: Paladin Promo Card
219983.description:
A Knight promo card for the game Sword of Kings
.

Card details:

Knight Name: Paladin

Power 2
Skill 2

Ability:
"As the Paladin, you may pray for your God's assistance at the start of your turn. Roll one die to see if your God has answered your prayer; 1-4 nothing happens; 5-6 add one to your Power or Skill this turn; 7-8 remove a Tunnel Delay from your tunnel and place it on the Rubble Pile."

This promo card can be found in Game Trade Magazine issue 204 (Feb. 2017).

219986.name: Hood
219986.description:
Translated from Finnish:

In Hood player characters take part in adventures that the gamemaster has prepared. To play a roleplaying game you need at least one gamemaster and one player. Hood is meant for players of ages 10 and up.

Publisher's blurb:

Hood-roolipelissä pelaajien hahmot seikkailevat Robin Hoodin legendan innoittamissa pelinjohtajan valmistelemissa seikkailuissa. Roolipelin pelaamiseen tarvitaan vähintään pelinjohtaja ja yksi pelaaja. Hood on tarkoitettu kaikenikäisille 10-vuotiaasta ylöspäin.

219987.name: ColourCards
219987.description:
ColourCards is a game system. It consists of a deck of 100 unique coloured cards which are used to play many different games which are quick to learn and play.

The cards use five 'colours’: Red, Blue, Green, Black and White. Each card has three ‘aspects’: Word, Text and Background. The Word is the name of one of the five colours, the Text of that word is written in one of the colours, and the Background of the card is in a different colour. Three different colours may feature in a card's aspects, but if the background or text is the same colour as the word, the card will only have two colours.

There are many different games that can be played with ColourCards. These include ColourCall (spot which colour appears the most among a set of cards), ColourCount (write down how many times each colour appears among a set of cards), ColourSeek (deduce the aspects of a hidden card), ColourSet (find 2 cards with 5 colours), ColourPairs (find 2 cards with matching colours), ColourFind (a memory game of finding matching cards), ColourPerudo (a bluffing and guessing game where players challenge each other until only one remains), ColourFamilies (a cooperative game of making 'families' of 5 related cards), ColourCry (race against each other to put matches cards on top of each other to empty your hand), ColourSnap (a 2-player game of collecting your opponent's cards), ColourSpeed (quickly say the colour of the writing - based on the Stroop test).

219989.name: Anthropomorphic
219989.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Anthropomorphic is a nostalgic throwback to the 90's comics and cartoons which made all the protagonists transformed animals with incredible powers and human like qualities. This rules lite system includes character generation tables, super cool equipment rules, vehicle action rules, custom character sheet as well as introductory adventure all at an unbeatable price!

219990.name: Double Picks
219990.description:
User summary:
ダブルピックス (Daburu Pikkusu) is the risk-taking card game Double Picks.

Each turn, you reveal a card from the deck, and when you reveal the same card as one of the cards revealed so far, you must take all of them. Instead of revealing a card, you may take the last card revealed.

Cards are numbered 1-9, and there are more cards with higher values than those with lower values. Cards with lower values are colored blue and are counted as one negative point each. Other cards are red and counted as negative points equal to their face value. You should consider the risk of taking negative points while making your decisions.

Description from the publisher:
1～9の数字カードがあり、大きい数字ほど枚数が多く、小さい数字ほど枚数が少ない構成になっています。各プレイヤーが山札から1枚ずつカードをめくって場に出していき、すでに場に出ている数字と同じ数字が出たら場のカードを失点として引き取ります。失点を避けてカードをめくらずにパスをすることもできます。パスをするときは直前にめくられたカードを1枚だけ引き取ります。数字には赤と青の2色が存在し、赤の数字はカードの枚数が失点となり、青の数字はカードに書かれている数字が失点になります。いかに失点を減らすか、リスクを考えてカードをめくるギャンブルゲームです。

219992.name: Pathogen: Unclassified
219992.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Pathogen: Unclassified is an apocalyptic survival horror role-playing game. It is set three years after a global parasitic outbreak took over by altering people's minds. It struck fast and without mercy. Over time, the uninfected survivors (approximately 9% of the world population) realized not all the infected were the same. They were still alive, but the parasite is in control of the host's body.

219993.name: Of Drow Origin
219993.description:
From the back of the book:

Matron Mother has learned that something of drow origin has been located in a human settlement and sends her trusted daughters to deal with the matter. When they arrive they find themselves interrupting a wedding reception. What secrets will be discovered and which will remain?

This story based module favors roleplay and is good for beginners and experienced players alike. Characters built to fit the scenario are included and is written for 4-9 players.

From the Kickstarter page:

Of Drow Origin is a tale of intrigue and shifting loyalty. This one-shot module has a very high replay value, caters to new players and veterans, and features unique game play scenarios which ultimately resolve through PVP interaction (combat and non-combat).

This project contains a full package of goodies certain to appeal to all types of gamers, including a beautifully illustrated book chock full of unique content and extras that make this a grab-and-go solution for DMs that want to run a game for friends, a party, or convention. As written this game is intended for NINE players but scales well down to as few as four or five.

The story is written with an emphasis on roleplay. Character levels range from two to eleven making choosing allies an all-important task. Each of the nine main characters has a short background that provides just enough ambiguity to allow players to insert themselves into the heads of their character while still making decisions that make each play-through different. By focusing on the roleplay, this game has wide appeal to all levels of experience, while still keeping the power-gamers second guessing every choice.

219994.name: Sig: Manual of the  Primes
rpgpodcastepisode: Bonus Episode – Dissecting Sig with Jason Pitre
219994.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Sig: Manual of the Primes is a cosmopolitan planar fantasy tabletop RPG. Like other games in this genre, it presents a diverse city and the challenges of culture clash. It's a setting that juxtaposes planar magics with urban drama. It offers players the opportunity to travel to the planes of existence and explore the prime worlds.

219995.name: Cold Shadows
219995.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Cold Shadows is a narrative tabletop role-playing game where the rules are focused on telling a dynamic, personal and compelling story. The game is set in a taut world of espionage, betrayal, and drama.

Cold Shadows is written to evoke the feeling of the Cold War era of spies both in modern and historical context. The game can easily be used to tell espionage stories in any 20th and 21st century time-frame.

219996.name: MATEVO
219996.description:
User summary
マトエヴォ (MATEVO) is a Japanese deduction game with a graph to plot opinions.

At the beginning of the game, players are dealt X and Y axis cards, which are placed on your personal board face-down to form an X-Y graph that represents evaluation criteria such as hot/cold and good/bad.

Each turn, you give a word card to another player, and that player plots the card on their own graph at their discretion.

At the end of the game, players guess other players' axis cards from the word cards they have plotted.

User summary
各プレイヤーに、物事の評価基準を示す「縦軸」「横軸」のカードが配られる（例：熱い／冷たい、善／悪）。ターン毎に、他プレイヤーに対し「ワード」カードを渡し、渡されたプレイヤーは自分の（秘密の）評価基準で、自分のチャート上どの位置になるかを示す。
各ワードの配置を見て、縦軸、横軸の評価基準を当てるゲーム。

219997.description:
UNRELEASED GAME

Publisher's blurb:

The Black Book [contains] non-player characters, enemy agencies, and more.

219999.description:
This Mythic Battles: Pantheon Compendium is a collection of adventures and articles for the game. It has 3 main sections:

Campaigns
Painting Guide
Terrain Building Guide

The Compendium includes 3 complete, and very different, campaigns. Each was written by a different author (or authors), and takes the core of the Mythic Battles: Pantheon game and twists it in a new way.
219999.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Compendium

220000.description:
Kickstarter backers are the God Pledge level or above will receive a great number of exclusive items as stretch goals that will not be available at retail. These Kickstarter-exclusive stretch goals, as well as the non-exclusive stretch goals, together make up "Pandora's Box."

Inside, this upgraded Pandora’s Box holds a set of bespoke thermoformed trays that snugly hold every single Stretch Goal model unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign, including those that were exclusive to the Kickstarter.

Each model includes associated dashboards/stat cards, activation cards, and tokens.
220000.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Pandora's Box
